												I probably would have enjoyed playing this game if it actually worked properly. Don't buy this game, it's a disgusting excuse for a pc-port. I've spent hours trying to get the game to work properly but it just can't. There are so many things wrong with this game. People even had cases where having a camera attatched to their pc was the cause of the game screwing up. Although that's an easy thing to fix by disabling your camera for most of us who can't get this game to work, the fix isn't so simple and there might not even be one. This game has been out on steam for nearly 3 years and it's still horrid. If this game is really something that interests you wait for it to go on sale. I bought the game for about $6 on sale but don't even pay that, wait for it to go to like $3 and try your luck with it but if it doesn't work, don't expect a patch to fix it because if the game has been out for this long and it still has such big problems then the developers obviously don't give a s***. TLDR: Don't buy this game. Sure, Eden Studios released a game called Test Drive Unlimited 2 on PC but it's an insult to all PC gamers to call this a PC-Port.

content:
7, 2014
												Pros: -Cruising is fun and relaxing as hell.-The wide selection of vehicles is definitely a plus.-There are many, many hours of roads to drive on and many secrets to discover.Cons:-The races aren't challenging in the slightest.-The physics are absolutely horrid.-The police chase system is beyond broken.    -EMPs that shut your car down for several seconds.   -Cops that drive the opposite direction to ram you head-on every 3 seconds.   -Said physics give cops seemingly infinite mass allowing them to knock your ♥♥♥♥ around.   -Going offroad leads to helicopters that can arrest you from the air without any ground forces.   -You can be arrested even while doing 80kmph.-Terrible voice acting/character models. This wouldn't be an issue if a decent portion of the game wasn't centered around your in-game avatar. -Your in-game cell phone CONSTANTLY rings telling you to do certain tasks. If you're just cruising, tough ♥♥♥♥.-The launcher of the game is EXTREMELY temperamental. Some times the game launches, but most of the time you'll receive an error and a crash report.

content:
er 2, 2013
												02/01/2014If you look at the steam store today, you will notice that ths game has sold out!That should be enough to make you get it!The game is everything a Social Racing Gamer could ask for.The game is very challenging as it calls for you to have an almost perfect race in most cases and obtaining the in game licenses can take some time to get a hang of due to no assist on steering when you drive any cars in the driving schools. Dont let it frustrate you though, take a break, come back later and do it.Once you have the licenses sorted the game comes with endless hours of fun and social gameplay.The ultimate game for cruising with friends as there is a collision enabled free roam as well as indicators for all cars! Combined with the cockpit view, you get an incredible feeling, atleast i do.It is a lifestyle game, from expensive clothes, to houses, to beautiful car showrooms and garages to the 100 cars in game its everything I could ask for!With regards to the DLC, I would recommend not buying any as there are issues with atari tokens and there is no support as the studio has been shut down. The game is still fun without the DLC as normally they are just special versions of already in game cars with a few exceptions.The handling is somewhere in between arcade and sim, but i found the hardcore mode very interesting, but make sure for the harder steering modes you have a force feedback available controller (Almost impossible to win races, etc if you dont).The graphics in the game are bearable, but a little distance away from the new games released. But for a game that has scaled down maps of Ibiza and an island in Hawaii (Oahu), i guess they had to cut down some graphics somewhere. The graphics in the houses, garages and showrooms are beautiful though and you can open doors of cars, start engines and invite other friends over and much more.Pros:Beautiful carsUnlimited vinyl customisationSocial aspectsOver 4 hours to drive around the islandsCons:Not user friendly at first - Once you understand the way it works your fineDriving is challengingServer problems - you need to sort out ports for connection (long process)DLC - risky to purchase coz of bugsOverall its an excellent nostalgic game altho it does have a few bugs... all in all if you can work around the bugs its amazing! good to play with a bunch of friends..

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
y 6, 2015
												As a fan of Test Drive Unlimited 1 on XBOX 360 I was put off with all the reviews I have read when it came out so much in fact I forgot about the game until a friend of mine mentioned it during the Winter Sale 2014, He paid for himself and me a copy about £3.49 I think it was and oh boy how Atari just rushed this out and tried to get as much coin in before they went bust or to whatever state there in now. The game is terrible from the very first game car handling is out the window and is just stiff and arcady, vehicle sounds are awful mostly to me seem re used for every car but higher pitched for high end cars, the island looks ok not upgraded in visuals over TD1 as I would of thought.The story is awful your car parker guy who starts off dreaming he's been giving a Ferrari which turns out the woman who gives you it it nothing but the real owner of the car???, who then thinks she is punishing you by driving her to her destination because she's going to be late okkkkkkkkkkkk. The voice acting is terrible really poor like they just used the own devs creating the game to give the samples to save money, your player while driving the car is as stiff as a bloke getting a rectal exam it's beyond a joke.But it's the installation of the game thats a right royal pain in the backside for anyone installing it now it still has secuROM whch to me is pointless considering Atari really ain't around anymore and sometimes the online are up or down. With this game registering through STEAM why bother with SecuROM what's the point really I will be always baffled as to why games carry such things when you need to be signed into STEAM for most games they could of just gave it an always online system. In todays games we mostly are always online for multiplayer but I don't think a game like this really needs SecuROM, it took me about 30 mins to understand what to do to activate the dam game basically you copy and paste the CD KEY into the box provided to activate it and your LIMITED to 4 yes 4 ACTIVATIONS which you can earn back when you remove it but again this system is just pointless.

P.s. there is an active nodding community of you want cars like lambos and others, but I haven't tried those yet , try googling "tdu unofficial patch :)"

Awesome environment And that's about it.Cons:1. Voice acting out of a ♥♥♥♥ing flea market2. Every, I mean EVERY car feels heavy in the rear, resulting in an unrealisting tendency to lose control at launch and slight corners.3. The penalty system is ♥♥♥♥ed up. 4. DLCs. Soundtrack is crap.Racing purists, be warned. This is a game made by people who do not know how cars work. Heck, they still think gravity is magic. You can expect to smash up your computer in.... 5 hours... provided you were stupid enough to buy this crap. I've already gone through five PCs and this one's falling apart. This isn't a racing game, this is a rage game.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
3, 2011
												I didn't have really high expectations for this one, since I never really got into the first TDU. Not sure why, the world felt empty, there were no pedestrians, and if you passed the finish line/checkpoint (read; but didn't stop) you had to restart all over. I mean... if I PASSED the finish line or checkpoint, didn't I finish it ? Even if I drove over ? But that was TDU1. Does TDU2 do things differently ? I can't tell. I've played for 30+ hours now and I haven't bothered to check. What does that say ? That it's a fun, addicting game. It's no sim by any means, but you get to drive around wherever you want, collecting cars and parts, taking pictures, buying garages, things like that. And you can take your time to do these things. It's quite relaxing. And if you want to start a race with the computer or anyone else, you can do that too. Only thing I hate so far is the social stuff they put in it. You just can't ignore the The Sims influences. Pity. But... still recommended ![Rating: 85/100]

number of helpful: 5 of 11 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
er 27, 2014
												I don't feel this game deserves an in-depth review because it really isn't any good at all. I really did give this game a try, but I constantly get frustrated by the bad driving controls and overall "clunky" driving. At first it was do-able with the lower tier cars, but as I progressed further into the game and finally got myself a nice Pagani, it just got worse. I can't describe it well other than that you have to slow WAY down to even think about making a sharp turn without going off-road into a guardrail. And sometimes you will be driving and come upon part of the road where you can get some air, but when you do it is a terrible feeling, like the game doesn't want you to be doing huge jumps, so you land with an extremely unsatisfying "thud" and occasionally lose control.You absolutely NEED a controller for this game. There are no exceptions when it comes to using the keyboard; it just doesn't work. And even still it will take you forever to get used to them, especially if you have played other racing games that actually have good controls.I also didn't bother to pay attention to the story, if there even is one. The voice acting is really bad and the character animations aren't smooth and look bad as well. It was actually embarrasing. They even went so far as to re-use the same dumb dialogue before starting a race, after finishing driving school, and so on.That's another thing that was absolutely irritating was the driving schools. The handling of some of the driving school cars are even worse than anything else in the game. You can actually just hold down the gas upon starting and the car will spin out in a matter of seconds. It took me many, many tries to pass the completely pointless driving schools, and by the way, you won't use several of the "driving techniques" they teach you in them.The AI of everything in this game (other racers, the police, traffic) can either be really stupid or completely normal. Do NOT bother with the cops in this game because it is ridiculous. Once you get into a chace you better be ready to face 10+ police vehicles come at you head on or slam into you. You cannot ram them off-road, you cannot disable them. If you hit one you are basically screwed because it's like hitting a brick wall. You also can't go off-road yourself or else the helicopter will just randomly arrest you SOMEHOW, even with no cop cars around. You HAVE TO stay on the road.I was also excited (at first) to see that they had the Corvette ZR1 and some other really cool cars, but guess what? It's DLC that you can no longer purchase. Why put the car in the dealership in the first place if it's just DLC? However, they managed to get a couple things right in this game. The open world is quite nice and very large, allowing you to take nice cruises or just go extremely fast on straight roads. It is detailed, along with all the vehicles, and the game does have nice graphics. There is a decent selection of cars that you can put decals on and re-paint, although the decals are EXTREMELY limited and it is a pain to put them on.Overall, this game is frustrating. The bad controls, occasionally dumb AI, driving school, and several other things contribute to this frustration. Maybe I will give this another try sometime but for now I will not recommend it to anyone, as it is no longer being supported and really needs to be patched. 5/10.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME FULL-PRICED, DO NOT BUY IT ON SALE.
IF YOU BOUGHT THIS GAME ALREADY, TRY TO GET A REFUND.
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.This game looks, feels, and plays like it was released 20 years ago.Graphics are terrible quality.Controls are unusable.Audio quality is abominable, and scratches at most frequencies.There is no fullscreen mode.The menus are awfully designed and hard to navigate.The "storyline" is forced and weak.Voice-acting could have been done better by robots.Frame-rates are too low, even in 1080p with low settings, the game is just too clunky to render properly.The DRM is an ancient relic. Even then, you have to register the game with Atari's servers, which may or may not be up: you just have to be lucky.There is no reason for you to buy this game.Do not buy it, under any circumstances.I would not buy it again, EVEN IF IT WAS FREE.You have been warned

content:
30, 2015
												After a long time of giving this game a chance I can finally put it to rest! What could have been a fantastic open world racer ended up being a poor excuse with lackluster handling that made any other game better! However using a steering wheel and triple screens along with the in-game scenery and exploration kept me coming back until I recently bought a new wheel setup - the Thrustmaster TX with T3PA Pedals and TH8A Shifter. Of course, naturally, in true 'TDU2' form, it didn't recognise the setup! Seeking out a new and better open world racer I decided to finally purchase 'The Crew', it's handling model is nothing to boast about but then again, neither was 'TDU2's'!!!TDU2 is not recommended to anyone wanting a great open world racer on PC - 'TDU1' is still better and 'The Crew' really does compete with it's expansive world and pretty awesome customisation!

content:
2014
												physics are a bit strange, while its fun in itself its not realistic. customization fell horribly short of what i wanted, you can change your cars color, stickers, sometimes rims and thats it visually, very few upgrade possibilites, its very linear tier 1- 3, there are real cars but no real parts, which i found strange. you can go off roading in this game, which they actually did very well, but there are very few rally cars in the game with which to do so, and the rally cars that do exist, fall short due to the inability to upgrade them for dirt track use, everything in the game seems to have been pre-tuned for street use. you cannot use the keyboard with this game, at the very least you need an xbox controller - you can use a racing wheel but the tuning options are almost useless. aside from the physics, poor story, and lack of customization its a cool simulator, everything is very detailed, its just not a realistic smulator. i am by no means a professional driver, but i have done amatuer rally, and ive been to several tracks in NYS, with a Subaru Forester (in which i am furious this game does not have, it is an excellent rally vehicle)

												I was so excited to play this game. Seriously, I was. Bought it with real money, sat down and stared at the 2 hour long downloading screen. Once it finished, I perked up and waited for DX and all that. Then, to my suprise, I got a launcher promting me to download another 1.07GB of files. content:
22, 2014
												Terrible, terrible game. Test Drive Unlimited is one of the best racing games ever made with excellent, near fantastic, handling of the cars. But with the sequel they have redone it all, and it is all for the bad. If you take a non off road car, off road there's a speed limiter, you simply cannot go past 100 km/h or whatever the speed was. It even goes for 4x4 cars that the game consider a street car. It's not that they start to handle super poorly or just start spinning, no no, they simply cannot go any faster.That's just the worst thing I remember. The overall handling was really poor as I recall it. Why I put over 100 hours in it I will never understand. I got it as a gift, I really wanted it to be fun and I had some friends that I played it with. But it was never any good. The only positive was probably addition of getting cash for driving "dangerously", I love that stuff! Guess the car customization was pretty decent as well. Now that TDU1 (servers) has been shut down for a long time, would it not be better to play TDU2 than no TDU at all? No. Leave it be.Edit: I might add this video of me just joining up with some random players in TDU1, having a blast, just cruising around. Nothing close to this is to be found in TDU2, the player base seem to be something completely different. No one ever seemed to have any interest in cruising around together. They either started bumping you or simply warp somewhere else. But yeah, this video captured some of my fondest memories from online gaming. 


YouTube™ Video: Test Drive Unlimited: Multiplayer Cruise 

			Views: 20,235		

			Had just been driving around when I stumbled across these German guys (at least some of them seemed to be). And ended up having a pretty good cruise! 4-5 Aston Martins and a couple of other cars.

content:
10, 2014
												Recommended for sure... and why?Well, it's an open world racing game. You've got acces to a big stash of cars, which you obviously have to buy with the in-game money you make. The cars themselves are very detailed, extrior and intrior. The roads you can ride on are big and amazing. Every country has it's own style (Ibiza, (Spain) and Hawaii). There are a lot of side activities to do, so that you can earn a good load of money and buy your dream car.Although there won't be any new updates, the game works pretty fine and has some DLC cars (where you have to pay for (Atari coins)).Like every game it has it's weak spots, and there are still things unfinished, bugged, missing etc.. But overall this game is still, anno 2014, worth buying it.

content:
22, 2014
												Terrible, terrible game. Test Drive Unlimited is one of the best racing games ever made with excellent, near fantastic, handling of the cars. But with the sequel they have redone it all, and it is all for the bad. If you take a non off road car, off road there's a speed limiter, you simply cannot go past 100 km/h or whatever the speed was. It even goes for 4x4 cars that the game consider a street car. It's not that they start to handle super poorly or just start spinning, no no, they simply cannot go any faster.That's just the worst thing I remember. The overall handling was really poor as I recall it. Why I put over 100 hours in it I will never understand. I got it as a gift, I really wanted it to be fun and I had some friends that I played it with. But it was never any good. The only positive was probably addition of getting cash for driving "dangerously", I love that stuff! Guess the car customization was pretty decent as well. Now that TDU1 (servers) has been shut down for a long time, would it not be better to play TDU2 than no TDU at all? number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2014
												I have a lot of nostalgic memories when I played this on the Xbox. Now that I have it on PC, I can re-live those memories once again.But enough nostalgia, let's talk about TDU2.Test Drive Unlimited 2 is an open-world racing game set in Ibiza (and Oahu once you've progressed enough).I like to think of it as a racing RPG, as you can level up your character, and gain special perks, such as discounts, new haircuts, cars, etc.But in the end, where it really shines is in its multiplayer. You drive around with others in a game session, and they can challenge you to races, hang out in your house, and even make a club with you!In the end, I recommend this very much.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
2014
												physics are a bit strange, while its fun in itself its not realistic. customization fell horribly short of what i wanted, you can change your cars color, stickers, sometimes rims and thats it visually, very few upgrade possibilites, its very linear tier 1- 3, there are real cars but no real parts, which i found strange. you can go off roading in this game, which they actually did very well, but there are very few rally cars in the game with which to do so, and the rally cars that do exist, fall short due to the inability to upgrade them for dirt track use, everything in the game seems to have been pre-tuned for street use. you cannot use the keyboard with this game, at the very least you need an xbox controller - you can use a racing wheel but the tuning options are almost useless. aside from the physics, poor story, and lack of customization its a cool simulator, everything is very detailed, its just not a realistic smulator. i am by no means a professional driver, but i have done amatuer rally, and ive been to several tracks in NYS, with a Subaru Forester (in which i am furious this game does not have, it is an excellent rally vehicle)

content:
30, 2015
												After a long time of giving this game a chance I can finally put it to rest! What could have been a fantastic open world racer ended up being a poor excuse with lackluster handling that made any other game better! However using a steering wheel and triple screens along with the in-game scenery and exploration kept me coming back until I recently bought a new wheel setup - the Thrustmaster TX with T3PA Pedals and TH8A Shifter. Of course, naturally, in true 'TDU2' form, it didn't recognise the setup! Seeking out a new and better open world racer I decided to finally purchase 'The Crew', it's handling model is nothing to boast about but then again, neither was 'TDU2's'!!!TDU2 is not recommended to anyone wanting a great open world racer on PC - 'TDU1' is still better and 'The Crew' really does compete with it's expansive world and pretty awesome customisation!

												I bought this game right when it was out. I loved it at the time, but now the game is sadly.. a big pile of crap. number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
5, 2016
												so, you know those kinda days, when you get home from work, sick of the all ♥♥♥♥ going on and you feel like you need few moments just to sit the ♥♥♥♥ down and forget all on earth? Sure we all have those. TDU2 is an enormous world of 2 real but not 100% copied islands + not a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, but anyways around 80 cars. Everything this game features - brief and not that satisfying. The singleplayer campaign and the plot are purely for "well, at least they are there", multiplayer is not really popular - whole system is messed up and nobody really plays ranked races. Gameplay most of the time stale and similar to what you were doing a week ago - just driving. Well, on those days I mentioned above, there is some reason to put some chill music on, take a PS3 controller, put Steam into Big Screen and for a few hours seamlessly roam around,  slowly taking over the completion of the game. This ♥♥♥♥ is atmospherical and cheap, which is good. Also it once had a large mod community which improved the game, fixed bugs, added cars and done a lot of useful thing, but setting all this to work will require some very reasonable time, which is bad. And when I say some time - I literally mean few days, not only installing mods but also making the account and activating the game is a cluster♥♥♥♥ due to server down times + the whole system being buggy. Of course, you can play out of the box, right after you install it, without all patching. Out of games like this, for which I can find only one example of The Crew, this is the best. Some anger tho' is inevidable cuz making it to work will really take some time. But nothing more, than those days. But I can't say for sure, maybe you could find something in it for yourself. TL;DR: not really worth, but sometimes comes handy.

content:
, 2015
												Where do I begin...The handling, the traffic, the police, the races, the oppo-Honestly, I don't even know.All I thought this game was, was a free roam, test drive-car game.No racing, no licenses, no buying cars. I guess I was wrong.What do you do in the game?Race jerks, get hassled by jerks- yep, jerks -what else..nothing.It's not until you get rich- $666666666 -that you can actually free roam.  It is just stupid. Who names a racing game 'Test Drive Unlimited? It had me under the impression that you test driveexotic and muscle cars, and drive around an expansive map, with no limits... no cops... no races... no economy...just nothing- except cars of course -don't be fooled.You might be saying "You only have 5 hours record! You know nothing!!!"Sure, say it.But that's certainly enough time to regret buying this game.At least add an option to free roam only...No racing, etc.--No. Just no.Don't waste your money.If you're looking for a good racing game.. get this- just kidding -get Project CARS or something.If you're looking for a good free roam car game.. don't get this.Get 'Driving Simulator' or 'City Car Driving', etc.

content:
4, 2015
												I dont know what the issues are with everyone and the servers, the game is fine for me, BUT i will say this.If you are looking for a simulation driving game, this is not it.Although i have only played 30 hours, i can tell you, around 25 of those are me just yelling at the screen at how bad the control is of a vehicle with a steering wheel. The clutch is broken (it works like a button) the gears on the cars are wonky (The camaro does around 200 kmh in 3rd gear with around 5000 RPM) and the force feedback is almost non apparent.Instead of treating the steering wheel AS a steering wheel it treats it as a controller with buttons, there is no level of how linear the pedals can be, only a delay which makes the controls awful, because its either full throttle when the pedal pushed about 4 millimeters and the brakes are just hell on earth, because the brakes are always on full becuase it treats the pedals like buttons, the brake lights dont even turn on unless the pedal is pushed down to a certain area, this also means the brakes will have been pushed 2 millimeters and you will have gone from 120 kmh to about 50 in 0.4 seconds. And the clutch, that pile of ♥♥♥♥ that is! I have not seen anything as terrible as this! the brakes and accelerator, i could manage, nearly, but the clutch is absolute rubbish! Once again its an on or off scenario, but at least with this one it has to be fully depressed to activate (but with all the goods this game has it has its bad) but in order for the clutch to be released it has to go all the way back up, there is no half way point, this means that a take off is impossible, you can rev the engine to its redline and take the clutch off and the car will either (depending on what car it is) A:Do a burnout or B:The revs will drop below 1000 and you will be yelling at the screen because of the slow take off.Now the gear ratios are my final bit of this rant, the are all over the flipping place, some cars have 1st gear that goes to 20, others to 100, now THIS is the icing on the cake of dog ♥♥♥♥ that this game calls 'handling'. The camaro has 6 gears, around 3 of which you will not bother to use, because once you get over 120 kmh, handling becomes so bad that if you take your foot off the accelerator and turn the wheel at a slow pace, you will not move. If you have been in a real car and done this you WILL move, but this game is just broken in the handling scripts. now on some cars this is different, but the experience is much the same.To some up (and to add) the game is good for a keyboard user, and even though being considered a racing sim, its more of an arcade derby because the controls make it feel that way and also you cant control the car most of the time so you're going to crash into other cars. Bad at least the sounds are decent...

content:
er 14, 2015
												The game is good but the problem I have is that the multiplayer aspect is really hard to get into being 2015 (which is understandable I suppose since the game is getting very close to 5 years old which would probably make reviewing the game kind of redundant- the last news update for the game was after holiday 2014 restoring the servers). Also a little unrelated to the game is signing up to make an account with TDU2... it's not as easy as it would seem for whatever reason. I signed up on their site, and used it on the game when I first got it open but it seems that I have two accounts under the same user name (how dows that even work?) because I can play the game online but when I check on my profile on testdriveunlimited2.com it says I don't have the game. Also I have DLC for a Zonda in-game but I have no clue on how to redeem it because I could redeem it on TDU2 but I don't want to do that because inputting the key for the game on the site does not work because I redeemed it with Steam. I suppose there is a way to redeem it on Steam but I've not seen a way to do it in-game.The servers don't seem to be online most of the time and when they are I've began fearing getting disconnected from said servers (I just got in a second time while playing and got disconnected near the end of a event- so not cool).There is offline mode, which works fine. The game kind of emulates being online with other players that are AI controlled (I really thought at first that they were actual players at first). However to be honest, I got this game for the sole purpose of playing with friends and running single player kind of takes away my whole purpose of wanting the game. If only I had gotten the game when it was new, the servers would probably still be up and (possibly) lively but then again a games luster wears off quickly these days, especially if the game is older.To be honest I really don't want to down-vote the game because even with the connecting to server problems I've been having the game is good I but I feel that I have to not recommend on the grounds of me coming into the game to play with friends and because of how the servers seem to be off and on there isn't really much I can recommend asides for playing the game offline.

content:
er 18, 2015
Test Drive Unlimited 2 seemed like the perfect racing game for me. Two large islands, an interesting selection of cars, a mix between arcade and simulation style driving and true open-world gameplay. Add to that the idea of actually buying appartments and garages to store your cars in, instead of simply having infinite garage space. It sounded great. And fun!However that "dream racing game" fell flat on its knees as soon as I had my first set of wheels. The reason for that was that I, at that moment, got to meet the game's biggest flaw: The driving physics.I know that you're in some games supposed to fiddle around with the driving settings to suit them to your taste and driving style and I did, or rather I tried.Every few hours I would change them a bit, hoping I would get closer to a setup I liked. I also tried so called recommended settings by several users on the Steam community or from the web, but none of them worked for me so far.And it's not like I played the game only for a few hours.I played it for 48 hours. In that time I went through the beginning parts of the "story" two times. The first time was pretty horrible, but the second time was even worse.I get it, as a developer you want to connect your gameplay through a story, but it sincerely doesn't help one bit if every character you meet is annoying and arrogant to the point where I can't stand them, even when they're loosing.Also the story isn't that original, too. Through luck you're taking part in the Solar Crown, a highly-regarded competition between drivers on Ibiza and Hawaii.I think the game would have been better without a story.The problem with this championship is that you'll drive against the same characters again and again. And their cutscenes before and after a race are pretty much the same every time.So not only are you going up against the same drivers again and again, there's also no pay-off after you beat them. Sure, you get their car if you beat them in a one on one race, but what does it matter if they're driving against you in the next race!?It also doesn't help that I was fighting my own vehicle more often than the other drivers.Because that is how it often felt to me. I could easily outrun the enemies, some races I would overtake the whole group several times and be several laps ahead.But every corner I pretty much had to fight my own vehicle to the point where it wasn't fun. And it's not like I completely suck at driving. I know how to drive a line, break and how to take corners...And after nearly 40 hours I couldn't take the story and the competition anymore.So I did what I like to do the most in open-world racers: I grabbed my set of wheels and took in the scenery.I spent the remaining hours of my playtime driving through both islands, simply exploring the world, chasing down highways, going down dead-end streets. Simply not caring for anything but my car and the road.However as much as I tried to not play the story or the races, the driving physics didn't change (obviously). Realizing this, that I wasn't enjoying what should be the core of any driving game, I simply uninstalled Test Drive Unlimited 2 and I sincerely doubt that I'll ever play it again.Sure, it's somewhat MMO like online mode, where you can meet other players randomly or some of the social stuff, for example you can actually ride inside other player's cars, are neat ideas.But a driving game should first and foremost do one thing: Be fun driving!And after 48 hours it just still isn't, despite me trying many varations of driving modes, settings and cars.So I cannot, despite me liking the ideas behind Test Drive Unlimited 2 and what it tried to do, recommend this game.

er 26, 2013
												The exotic cars are awesome, but the physics are not. Some of the license tests are frustrating as all hell, and the game pretty much forces you to pick specific cars for some races because picking anything else will screw you. There are some nifty features and the exploration is neat, but the license tests and the physics can be frustrating. If anything, get this on sale because it IS fun to drive Ferraris and Aston Martins at 200 mph down the freeway and being able to test drive any car is a great feature.

content:
er 25, 2014
												So, TDU was a pretty good game. Unsurprisingly, Atari and Eden went to make a sequel.Somewhere, they forgot that a driving game should be about the driving.The nature of this game would dictate arcade handling - being able to change direction fairly quickly without losing control. Unfortunately, what you get is fairly poor, as vehicles tend to slide.Somewhere along the line, the game got lost under the extras that got thrown in - the story, the *extra* collectibles, the casino... OK, they're nice extras, but all they are is extras. The action is in the driving, and when that is sub-par, it negatively impacts the entire game.It's no great surprise that Eden and Atari failed not too long after the release of this game.

content:
r 19, 2014
												I've owned TDU since it was released and played it through all its glitches on my XP/7 system and now on my Win8-8.1 system (fewer issues now). The scenic and vehicle aesthetic qualities are definitely TDU and TDU 2's best positives. Not so much on the AI or driving mechanics, but that's okay as long as you're not looking for a race sim or intend on making every corner/challenge with perfection. I find it interesting that some of the slower/cheaper cars seem to have much better handling than the more extravagant ones in TDU 2; that's just strange. But all-in-all, a very fun and visually-appealing game to play around in, especially using Nvidia 3D Vision 2!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
18, 2014
												It is neither as technical as any Codemasters game, nor as friendly-driven and arcade like Burnout and last Need for Speed iterations. But it has somewhat that you may have very fun (maybe the european approach made the game seems like that).It is an open-world driving game. As a valet driver, you basically do a bulk of events (including driving permission tests) from where you earn cash and experience. You have to win all the regional events (each one ends as a challenge against one of your rivals) in order to match a final "island grand cup", both in Ibiza and Hawaii islands (starting on first one).The soundtrack and the scenario modeling are the superb things. It is a very nice environment, beautifully shaped. But the character modeling is pretty bad, although (both graphically and about dialogues).The gameplay is reasonable. With a "PS2-like controller", you will have all the controls you need. The game is responsive and controlling the car is relatively easy. Maybe game menus are a little tricky sometimes, but it is a thing easily to be used to.The game has a overall moderate challenging factor. The simulation factor is not high. You cannot make a turn reckessly with your car in some categories, but when you master that (it's a little hard), you beat all championships easily. Maybe the greatest difficulty of game is finding the right car for the right event. Besides each model and its features, you must find the brand's sellers through the HUGE scenarios. There are many of the great high-level car brands (some are missing, likely due lack of agreements with manufacturers). You must explore both islands to complete the tasks given to you, find shops, enter championships and even to find multiplayer spots.You can customize your character (clothes and plastic surgery), your car (tuning, painting and so on) and the houses/manors you can buy.By the way, multiplayer is gradually being abandoned, but you will find people doing some weird things (like races that the fastest lap was one second...).The DLC's are not recommended. A couple of cars (not available in-game and has nothing effectively different from what you can purchase on the scenarios' stores) and a Casino that you may earn some cash to buy things. Both are expensive.You may have some fun. It's not a mind-blow. The game has a soft and relaxing mood sometimes due it's soundtrack and the locations chosen. Maybe it was intentional.

												TDU2 a amazing game to play with your friends and to just have a good time with them revolutionary graphics and awesome car details, in short words completely amazing.Now that was my review on the game when it first launched on Xbox 360 back in the days, now its a completely diffrent game.I saw it was on sale and I thought: Why not?, It was terrific on Xbox 360 so then its got to be even better on PC, unfortunatly I was terribly wrong.Even the developers think this game was so bad that they decided to pull the plug on it making it impossible to get proper support or to play online with anyone which removes like half of the whole experience of the game making it really boring and just another one of those games that you will regret that you have bought.So in short words you can see this game like a strong superhuman that has been batteling lots of illneses and still been able to deliver joy and happines to millions of people around the world, unfortunatly it catched a illness so bad that its eating it from the inside out.Its relatives have decided to not support it anymore they have just simply decided to pull the plug on it and left it to die in a dark abandonned room somewhere never to be restored to its former glory again.Rest in peace my friend, I will always remeber the happy moments you gave me and my friends.Would not recommend 4/10

												Ever hear a game described as a similar game but on crack? Well this game is like Burnout on a horse tranquilizer. Buyers Remorse Unlimited 2 removes all forms of possible fun by punishing the players for going off track, interacting with other cars, smashing into objects or doing anything remotely interesting. I wasn't just bored driving towards the races in the huge dull map I was bored in them, it is always hold accelerate, practically park when you see a corner to turn then back to holding accelerate. The only fun to be had is either in dicking around indoors like its Playstation Home or playing bumper cars with other players that also want to make the game feel less like Car Similator 2011.

												The exotic cars are awesome, but the physics are not. If anything, get this on sale because it IS fun to drive Ferraris and Aston Martins at 200 mph down the freeway and being able to test drive any car is a great feature.

												Ever hear a game described as a similar game but on crack? Well this game is like Burnout on a horse tranquilizer. The only fun to be had is either in dicking around indoors like its Playstation Home or playing bumper cars with other players that also want to make the game feel less like Car Similator 2011.

content:
10, 2011
												If this game had a smell it would be similar to that of old buttplugs dumped in sulpheric acid and stuck up your nose. So in other words, this game smells painfully bad.Gameplay: Cars, 3/10Graphics: tis shiny, 6/10Physics: Gran Turismo, 2/10Sound: vroom sounds. 6/10Story: uh, 0.125/10The first few minutes of gameplay consists of you choosing a pre-made character to play as during your amazing birthday party with a dumb chick outside of your expensive modern home. Dumb chick shows you a Ferrari she bought you. You drive the Ferrari down the road a bit and, WHOA! loud speaking, like dumb chick is trying to get your attention. Surprise; you're dreaming while asleep in the dumb chick's Ferrari. You're actually a poor racer-wannabe vallet dude working for this dumb chick's parents (or maybe that hotel you start at). That said, the dumb chick is waking you up and throws a tantrum and calls her dad. As you're about to lose your job, she realizes she's too dumb and a chick to drive her 483 horsepower sports car, so she makes you drive her to the race meet. As a reward, dumb chick let you race at said race meet. Shocking.You win, blah blah, first car, blah, some races, end of game, grats. Oh, and you obviously make money from each race, but once you beat the game your only source of income is driving fast, and racing online which I've never tried because the rest of the game is aids.Final rating: 3.4 std's/ 10 dumb chicks

content:
y 30, 2014
												I could only say you need to google it up in multiple review sites to get all the pieces together. You'll see why it sucks so badly. I could go on but knowing myself I'd probably go on for 100 lines of disrecommending.I'll go on with a few annoying things that occured to me in the game.Marcus (Something) after you're on your way for a championship, after a license... :"Hey little guy, it's Marcus, Listen, I don't remember teaching you all these techniques so you can just quit. The track awaits!"Me: rrrrghhh... Really? REALLY!!? I'm, like, at 20 F-----' meters from the ENTRY ICON down the road!! DON'T FRIGGIN' CALL ME NOW! My GPS is already targeting what you want me to, for cryin' out loud!!Other occurences of the such happen when you're at 30 KM (18.7Miles) away and you don't have a choice but to slog your way there, and all the time they're gonna call you and cuss you out for not making it here in a minute or so.The multiplayer sucks just as much, and so does the free-roam and instant challenge... and don't think you'll have a good time on your non-single player mode intended bike, or you'll be disappointed. people will ram you off, doesn't matter if they're 12, 20 ,30 years old or whatever. They'll ram the hell out of you. Bike or not, which means they're gonna get in their SUVs and block your road. If you're in a low speed car, avoid setting online interactions to "On" since it's just not worth it.About the instant challenge part, it's not even instant. On offline mode, the game shoves a random road down your throat and it's up to you to beat a C4 Lancia Delta(Classic 4 car class, AKA slow clunkers since the amount of upgrades in this game, simply put, sucks. more on that below.) Lancia Delta with your A4 Camaro (Asphalt 4 class, which divides into 7 categories. A4 Is middle of the road speed, with abysmal handling cars often) because it'll get a massive speed boost and it'll ram you.Online instant challenges are purgatory in terms of annoyance, you'll be purposedly rammed by the opponent players and if you've got a small car versus an SUV, you can expect you'll be blocked to a point where you'll wonder why this game mode even exists offline AND online!You try to get past the traffic? Nope. Even the traffic cars are evil, they'll speed up to intercept you, sometimes they spin out to try to avoid you but they'll often spin out in YOUR direction. With extreme convoy events, you'll lose a ton of your pay and that's if you're even lucky enough for the clean-driving meter to not empty.But why keep going on when the prize cash is just *419$ (*Referencial number to mean "Junk") and that the retries're infinite?You made it to the finish area before retrying? Congratulations, you just lost all your means of retrying this events. But who cares!? You've got better to do! Like grinding 1.6 million credits'ish to get a bugatti after you've spent stuff on cosmetic surgery (which makes your character looks like a donkey, and can only be applied to his already --gly face.) and got all your furniture.Oh wait, I'll use this trick...

Suddenly life just got a lot easier!!There's this video right here of a guy beating the cops with a 30'ish horsepower VW Beetle. Just shows how the game doesn't deliver, since I did the same and I won multiple times offline.


YouTube™ Video: TDU2: I get chased in my VW Bug by the FAIL police. 

			Views: 871		



Speaking of which (again) Don't try to catch up to a Bugatti Veyron 16.4 (Super Sport or not) when you get an offer to be the cop, The previous car in question is a super-top tier A1 car while they give you a Dodge Viper SRT *'08 (*Estimated year from what I think) which is a higher-mid tier A2 car. You won't stand the slightest chance.Oh no, I didn't stop on a dirt crossroad, that's a road violation... just gonna go off road to lower the meter, OH NO! I accidentally rammed a cop, gotta run!! ............Why isn't my violation bar filled? Oh and I need to be on an actual road/trail to lower this damn meter? All right, all right... Cool, It's starting to lower. OH NO! It's almost full since I collided with a few road-side light cylinders which aren't even lit during night time!! Okay, I'm gonna park my car aside of the road and cool my nerves down. Hey, the meter's going down. (Traffic car arrives behind) what the... OH NO IT'S FULL!!! They're targetting me!!! I'll go and hide!! (Hides in a GPS-wide wheat field) whew. (Finally empties) What a pursuit!!Oh wait it wasn't.Asphalt club races are NOTHING but but Bugatti Veyron ram-to-win contests. Both clubs're gonna ram each others' cars to the finishing line. Either this or a Buggy V8 (Which is super ugly and hard to drive, especially in the rain.)May the dirtiest win a few points toward their endless grind for a level 3 club... either this or take away 50,000$ off the instant challenge's unfortunate loser.Now I mentioned sooner there are license tests before? WHY, just WHY would there be license tests when richa-- illegal race events are the main focus?Mastery points were so much better.This game gets a big 5 out of 5 F.U. rating from me. (A la Wreckless Eating)Don't buy it, It's not worth your time.I know this whole b----ing review is about an outdated game, but still I needed to let my anger out.I'mma go get an infusion, a Vachon cake and chill out taking a walk in the neighborhood.Jumpin' outta subject for a bit...........Best way for me to get a break from such a hidden hell in what Marcus (The A license guy/ Whatever again) calls the rich mens' heaven is to do something you'll know will be enjoyable, and look, my PS Vita gave me Distance points in Disgaea 3 AoD for bringing my console with me and playing it while I walk around.Now THAT's enjoyable.But then I feel the need to come back and keep trying on and on and on and... you get the point.

content:
ry 7, 2015
												I can't recommend this game for most people.That said, it's one of my favorite games to just cruise, (say, after some GTA, or a real driving sim) and there are a handful of cars that drive well. It's not entriely acracde, nor simulation. This game really dumbs down, well, everything. The acting, animations and premises are stiff, emotionless and basically only serve to illustrate why this game failed so miserablely on release. It's the age-old, tried to do so many things, that it can't do anything well. It's pretty, as long as you don't look to hard, and it's fun if you're not expecting much. There's a lot that is just frustrating. Somehow, I've managed to log a couple hundred hours on this game despite all it's faults. Probably for lack of a suitable alternative.The Good:Being able to roam to 'real' islands.Quite a few cars, some are even good to drive.Somewhat pretty, if dated.The Bad:Online play sucks, when it works, populated by tools.Console-audience focused development is obvious.Single-player racing, while passable, is pretty uninspired.Some of the vehicle dynamics, like the consideration of torque curve vs horsepower curve or lack of adjustability in cars that have it from the factory, much less would get it as soon as you started swapping parts.The Ugly:All the non driving-related fluff. Poor tuning and performance options.Overall lack of diversity in traffic, there will be the same density of cars on dead-ends as freeways, day or night, rain or shine.Nagging NPCs, GPS and feature commentary.Some notable marquees are absent, while you can't help notice others.

content:
ber 25, 2015
												Test Drive is not really a bad game, just mediocre at best. The scenery was eye-popping at some points but most of the time was bland, and it just looked like a huge island with random hills and trees. The characters need alot more improvement- their expressions are dead, and their acting is ANNOYING. Their acting is repetitive and it doesn't even fit the character. Besided the sub-par animation on the characters, the graphics on the car is decent. It gives it the shiny touch and you can look at its decent interior. The island is massively huge and gives it alot of anticipation to explore, but like I said, details. One thing I like about this game is that you can create your own house and you can travel from Hawaii, to Ibiza. That is like a dream come true, but the looking around and the driving mechanics are coarse and gives it the Sims feel. I'm not sure if I mentioned that this game is often buggy, and the servers go down from time to time. It gets really annoying.                     Besides from all of the cons, there were some pros that I liked, but this game seriously needs improvement, and eden needs to fix the damn servers. The idea of this game was very amazing, but it just didn't hit me and I didn't quite get the experience I wanted. Do I recommend the game? No because it is not worth 19.99. 6 and lower is a better price.

content:
er 14, 2015
												The game is good but the problem I have is that the multiplayer aspect is really hard to get into being 2015 (which is understandable I suppose since the game is getting very close to 5 years old which would probably make reviewing the game kind of redundant- the last news update for the game was after holiday 2014 restoring the servers). Also a little unrelated to the game is signing up to make an account with TDU2... it's not as easy as it would seem for whatever reason. I signed up on their site, and used it on the game when I first got it open but it seems that I have two accounts under the same user name (how dows that even work?) because I can play the game online but when I check on my profile on testdriveunlimited2.com it says I don't have the game. Also I have DLC for a Zonda in-game but I have no clue on how to redeem it because I could redeem it on TDU2 but I don't want to do that because inputting the key for the game on the site does not work because I redeemed it with Steam. I suppose there is a way to redeem it on Steam but I've not seen a way to do it in-game.The servers don't seem to be online most of the time and when they are I've began fearing getting disconnected from said servers (I just got in a second time while playing and got disconnected near the end of a event- so not cool).There is offline mode, which works fine. The game kind of emulates being online with other players that are AI controlled (I really thought at first that they were actual players at first). However to be honest, I got this game for the sole purpose of playing with friends and running single player kind of takes away my whole purpose of wanting the game. If only I had gotten the game when it was new, the servers would probably still be up and (possibly) lively but then again a games luster wears off quickly these days, especially if the game is older.To be honest I really don't want to down-vote the game because even with the connecting to server problems I've been having the game is good I but I feel that I have to not recommend on the grounds of me coming into the game to play with friends and because of how the servers seem to be off and on there isn't really much I can recommend asides for playing the game offline.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
er 25, 2014
												So, TDU was a pretty good game. Unsurprisingly, Atari and Eden went to make a sequel.Somewhere, they forgot that a driving game should be about the driving.The nature of this game would dictate arcade handling - being able to change direction fairly quickly without losing control. Unfortunately, what you get is fairly poor, as vehicles tend to slide.Somewhere along the line, the game got lost under the extras that got thrown in - the story, the *extra* collectibles, the casino... OK, they're nice extras, but all they are is extras. The action is in the driving, and when that is sub-par, it negatively impacts the entire game.It's no great surprise that Eden and Atari failed not too long after the release of this game.

It's like translating French into German then into Swahili, and then into English through a broken Google Translate app.  The facial animations are unnerving to say the least.Okay. The launcher kept saying I had an unsafe connection.  ????   I tried to register on the website and recieved warnings that my information was not going to be safe.   Again, ????  I read somewhere else that the forums had been hacked.  I'm not sure about that, but I was unable to register so that I could play online for about a week.  No thanks.I wish I could get my money back.  Why does Steam have this on here?

content:
ber 24, 2014
												I originally wanted to like this game, having liked the concept of the first one and wanting a good open-world driving game. I heard all the negative feedback but decided to get it (two years after release) while it was cheap. Let's just say I'm glad I got it on sale.To start off, the game REALLY likes showing you the cutscenes and letting you hear the voice acting. The problem is that the human(oid) figures look like a high school student's class project and the voices sound like an obscure anime dub. I bought this game to drive, NOT to watch ReBoot. The terrain looks passable and didn't seem to be TOO distracting. As for the cars themselves, they look good for their time, but seem a bit too "plastic-y" and matte-finished. Normally you'd expect the driving to be the best attribute of a racing game, right? Well the driving here feels really stiff, more like the 2002 Test Drive iteration, and less like a game made in 2011. Cars either grip perfectly at insane speeds, or barely turn at all, which is a very bad business model for a car manufacturer.Soundtrack is a purely subjective thing, I know, but I personally don't think you could get more obscure, ear-violating, and volume-lowering music if you tried. The only saving grace is that one of the TWO stations plays electronic music that's actually tolerable as background noise.It's hard for me to say much about the optimization since I have newer hardware that could power through it, but I did get slight stutters every now and then on a GTX 670.Hindsight being 20/20, if I'd known that most of my 10 or so hours played would be spent tabbed out, I probably wouldn't have bothered.

ber 25, 2015
												Test Drive is not really a bad game, just mediocre at best. The scenery was eye-popping at some points but most of the time was bland, and it just looked like a huge island with random hills and trees. The characters need alot more improvement- their expressions are dead, and their acting is ANNOYING. Their acting is repetitive and it doesn't even fit the character. Besided the sub-par animation on the characters, the graphics on the car is decent. It gives it the shiny touch and you can look at its decent interior. The island is massively huge and gives it alot of anticipation to explore, but like I said, details. One thing I like about this game is that you can create your own house and you can travel from Hawaii, to Ibiza. That is like a dream come true, but the looking around and the driving mechanics are coarse and gives it the Sims feel. I'm not sure if I mentioned that this game is often buggy, and the servers go down from time to time. It gets really annoying.                     Besides from all of the cons, there were some pros that I liked, but this game seriously needs improvement, and eden needs to fix the damn servers. The idea of this game was very amazing, but it just didn't hit me and I didn't quite get the experience I wanted. Do I recommend the game? No because it is not worth 19.99. 6 and lower is a better price.

												Test Drive Unlimited 2 offers an exceptionally beautiful and detailed representation of both Ibiza and Hawaii. The choices are endless and the gameplay is slick, addictive and keeps you coming back for more. Completing challenges keeps the game valid and interesting. The enonomy system in the game adds a nice twist by allowing the player to progress through a scale of ten levels based on their current speed and driving skill (any colisions reduce the bank back to zero). This encourages better driving and allows you to build up money quite easily. Cars and houses can be purchased too. All in all, TDU2 is an exceptional game

content:
ry 7, 2015
												I can't recommend this game for most people.That said, it's one of my favorite games to just cruise, (say, after some GTA, or a real driving sim) and there are a handful of cars that drive well. It's not entriely acracde, nor simulation. This game really dumbs down, well, everything. The acting, animations and premises are stiff, emotionless and basically only serve to illustrate why this game failed so miserablely on release. It's the age-old, tried to do so many things, that it can't do anything well. It's pretty, as long as you don't look to hard, and it's fun if you're not expecting much. There's a lot that is just frustrating. Somehow, I've managed to log a couple hundred hours on this game despite all it's faults. Probably for lack of a suitable alternative.The Good:Being able to roam to 'real' islands.Quite a few cars, some are even good to drive.Somewhat pretty, if dated.The Bad:Online play sucks, when it works, populated by tools.Console-audience focused development is obvious.Single-player racing, while passable, is pretty uninspired.Some of the vehicle dynamics, like the consideration of torque curve vs horsepower curve or lack of adjustability in cars that have it from the factory, much less would get it as soon as you started swapping parts.The Ugly:All the non driving-related fluff. Poor tuning and performance options.Overall lack of diversity in traffic, there will be the same density of cars on dead-ends as freeways, day or night, rain or shine.Nagging NPCs, GPS and feature commentary.Some notable marquees are absent, while you can't help notice others.

												Pros: Reasonably fun driving, Licensing system similar to a dumbed down version of Gran Turismo, Decent range of cars and garage holdings.Cons: Outdated, terrible storyline, limited freedriving interspersed with the "game"I picked up this game looking for a PC option for games like Forza or Gran Turismo.  As a standalone, for the discount price, it's not awful, but it clearly is showing it's age at this point. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
y 28, 2014
												After the tons of fun that was Test Drive Unlimited, I bought the sequel, expecting more of the same good stuff. Boy, was I wrong...After the free-roaming driving game with many fun cars (and some nice bikes), plenty of different races/missions to do and a near complete lack of nonsense that was the first TDU, we get a sequel that has almost nothing of that.I'm completely uninterested in the online component, as I would rather play single player than be run into by various morons, strangers and griefers (no offense to you strangers who happen to be nice), which is the same way I felt about TDU1 (which I played 99+% offline), so I won't be commenting on any differences in that aspect. A simple LAN mode, with or without the possibility of setting up a dedicated server, would have made it a better game to play with friends and people one can tolerate.Anyway, in comparison with TDU1, TDU2 has some of the following differences:+ Slightly nicer graphics+ More than one island to drive around on+ Some weather- No Lamborghini cars (probably not the devs' fault, but they were some of the most fun ones in TDU1)- Really bad physics and car handling- A lot of dead weight in the form of bad narrative, boring cutscenes and other "cinematic" nonsense- A very linear progression, with missions locked until you complete the previous bunch.- Mandatory driving schools (several "tiers" of them for each of the three car types, too) before you can access a huge amount of the content. Also, they are harder to get through than most of the game, for no good reason. I hate them.To sum it all up...If you liked the first Test Drive Unlimited, you should avoid this.If you just want a fun driving/racing game (other than just cruising around), you should avoid this.If you like player freedom, you should avoid this.If you want a game free of "cinematic" garbage and general fluff, you should avoid this.If, on the other hand, you like being forced through bad narrative, watching cutscenes, playing frustrating mandatory tutorials and being rail-roaded through a really linear waste of time? Well, feel free to knock yourself out and play this. I know I won't touch it anymore. I'm just gonna go back and play TDU1 and  Need for Speed 3. At least, those games did racing and driving fun.

												I could only say you need to google it up in multiple review sites to get all the pieces together. You'll see why it sucks so badly. I could go on but knowing myself I'd probably go on for 100 lines of disrecommending.I'll go on with a few annoying things that occured to me in the game.Marcus (Something) after you're on your way for a championship, after a license... :"Hey little guy, it's Marcus, Listen, I don't remember teaching you all these techniques so you can just quit. The track awaits!"Me: rrrrghhh... Really? REALLY!!? I'm, like, at 20 F-----' meters from the ENTRY ICON down the road!! DON'T FRIGGIN' CALL ME NOW! My GPS is already targeting what you want me to, for cryin' out loud!!Other occurences of the such happen when you're at 30 KM (18.7Miles) away and you don't have a choice but to slog your way there, and all the time they're gonna call you and cuss you out for not making it here in a minute or so.The multiplayer sucks just as much, and so does the free-roam and instant challenge... and don't think you'll have a good time on your non-single player mode intended bike, or you'll be disappointed. people will ram you off, doesn't matter if they're 12, 20 ,30 years old or whatever. They'll ram the hell out of you. Bike or not, which means they're gonna get in their SUVs and block your road. If you're in a low speed car, avoid setting online interactions to "On" since it's just not worth it.About the instant challenge part, it's not even instant. On offline mode, the game shoves a random road down your throat and it's up to you to beat a C4 Lancia Delta(Classic 4 car class, AKA slow clunkers since the amount of upgrades in this game, simply put, sucks. more on that below.) Lancia Delta with your A4 Camaro (Asphalt 4 class, which divides into 7 categories. A4 Is middle of the road speed, with abysmal handling cars often) because it'll get a massive speed boost and it'll ram you.Online instant challenges are purgatory in terms of annoyance, you'll be purposedly rammed by the opponent players and if you've got a small car versus an SUV, you can expect you'll be blocked to a point where you'll wonder why this game mode even exists offline AND online!You try to get past the traffic? Nope. Even the traffic cars are evil, they'll speed up to intercept you, sometimes they spin out to try to avoid you but they'll often spin out in YOUR direction. With extreme convoy events, you'll lose a ton of your pay and that's if you're even lucky enough for the clean-driving meter to not empty.But why keep going on when the prize cash is just *419$ (*Referencial number to mean "Junk") and that the retries're infinite?You made it to the finish area before retrying? Congratulations, you just lost all your means of retrying this events. But who cares!? You've got better to do! Like grinding 1.6 million credits'ish to get a bugatti after you've spent stuff on cosmetic surgery (which makes your character looks like a donkey, and can only be applied to his already --gly face.) and got all your furniture.Oh wait, I'll use this trick...


YouTube™ Video: Test Drive Unlimited 2 - The Used Car Dealer Trade Trick (Money Tutorial) 

			Views: 58,364		

			The 100% legal, fast and easy way to boost your money on TDU2. All rights go to respective copyright holders. If you like the song and want it free (and legally), then the Madden Bothers have put it...		

Suddenly life just got a lot easier!!There's this video right here of a guy beating the cops with a 30'ish horsepower VW Beetle. Just shows how the game doesn't deliver, since I did the same and I won multiple times offline.


YouTube™ Video: TDU2: I get chased in my VW Bug by the FAIL police. 

			Views: 871		



Speaking of which (again) Don't try to catch up to a Bugatti Veyron 16.4 (Super Sport or not) when you get an offer to be the cop, The previous car in question is a super-top tier A1 car while they give you a Dodge Viper SRT *'08 (*Estimated year from what I think) which is a higher-mid tier A2 car. You won't stand the slightest chance.Oh no, I didn't stop on a dirt crossroad, that's a road violation... just gonna go off road to lower the meter, OH NO! I accidentally rammed a cop, gotta run!! ............Why isn't my violation bar filled? Oh and I need to be on an actual road/trail to lower this damn meter? All right, all right... Cool, It's starting to lower. OH NO! It's almost full since I collided with a few road-side light cylinders which aren't even lit during night time!! Okay, I'm gonna park my car aside of the road and cool my nerves down. Hey, the meter's going down. (Traffic car arrives behind) what the... OH NO IT'S FULL!!! They're targetting me!!! I'll go and hide!! (Hides in a GPS-wide wheat field) whew. (Finally empties) What a pursuit!!Oh wait it wasn't.Asphalt club races are NOTHING but but Bugatti Veyron ram-to-win contests. Both clubs're gonna ram each others' cars to the finishing line. Either this or a Buggy V8 (Which is super ugly and hard to drive, especially in the rain.)May the dirtiest win a few points toward their endless grind for a level 3 club... either this or take away 50,000$ off the instant challenge's unfortunate loser.Now I mentioned sooner there are license tests before? WHY, just WHY would there be license tests when richa-- illegal race events are the main focus?Mastery points were so much better.This game gets a big 5 out of 5 F.U. rating from me. (A la Wreckless Eating)Don't buy it, It's not worth your time.I know this whole b----ing review is about an outdated game, but still I needed to let my anger out.I'mma go get an infusion, a Vachon cake and chill out taking a walk in the neighborhood.Jumpin' outta subject for a bit...........Best way for me to get a break from such a hidden hell in what Marcus (The A license guy/ Whatever again) calls the rich mens' heaven is to do something you'll know will be enjoyable, and look, my PS Vita gave me Distance points in Disgaea 3 AoD for bringing my console with me and playing it while I walk around.Now THAT's enjoyable.But then I feel the need to come back and keep trying on and on and on and... you get the point.

content:
ry 7, 2015
												I can't recommend this game for most people.That said, it's one of my favorite games to just cruise, (say, after some GTA, or a real driving sim) and there are a handful of cars that drive well. It's not entriely acracde, nor simulation. This game really dumbs down, well, everything. The acting, animations and premises are stiff, emotionless and basically only serve to illustrate why this game failed so miserablely on release. It's the age-old, tried to do so many things, that it can't do anything well. It's pretty, as long as you don't look to hard, and it's fun if you're not expecting much. There's a lot that is just frustrating. Somehow, I've managed to log a couple hundred hours on this game despite all it's faults. Probably for lack of a suitable alternative.The Good:Being able to roam to 'real' islands.Quite a few cars, some are even good to drive.Somewhat pretty, if dated.The Bad:Online play sucks, when it works, populated by tools.Console-audience focused development is obvious.Single-player racing, while passable, is pretty uninspired.Some of the vehicle dynamics, like the consideration of torque curve vs horsepower curve or lack of adjustability in cars that have it from the factory, much less would get it as soon as you started swapping parts.The Ugly:All the non driving-related fluff. Poor tuning and performance options.Overall lack of diversity in traffic, there will be the same density of cars on dead-ends as freeways, day or night, rain or shine.Nagging NPCs, GPS and feature commentary.Some notable marquees are absent, while you can't help notice others.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
18, 2014
												It is neither as technical as any Codemasters game, nor as friendly-driven and arcade like Burnout and last Need for Speed iterations. But it has somewhat that you may have very fun (maybe the european approach made the game seems like that).It is an open-world driving game. As a valet driver, you basically do a bulk of events (including driving permission tests) from where you earn cash and experience. You have to win all the regional events (each one ends as a challenge against one of your rivals) in order to match a final "island grand cup", both in Ibiza and Hawaii islands (starting on first one).The soundtrack and the scenario modeling are the superb things. It is a very nice environment, beautifully shaped. But the character modeling is pretty bad, although (both graphically and about dialogues).The gameplay is reasonable. With a "PS2-like controller", you will have all the controls you need. The game is responsive and controlling the car is relatively easy. Maybe game menus are a little tricky sometimes, but it is a thing easily to be used to.The game has a overall moderate challenging factor. The simulation factor is not high. You cannot make a turn reckessly with your car in some categories, but when you master that (it's a little hard), you beat all championships easily. Maybe the greatest difficulty of game is finding the right car for the right event. Besides each model and its features, you must find the brand's sellers through the HUGE scenarios. There are many of the great high-level car brands (some are missing, likely due lack of agreements with manufacturers). You must explore both islands to complete the tasks given to you, find shops, enter championships and even to find multiplayer spots.You can customize your character (clothes and plastic surgery), your car (tuning, painting and so on) and the houses/manors you can buy.By the way, multiplayer is gradually being abandoned, but you will find people doing some weird things (like races that the fastest lap was one second...).The DLC's are not recommended. A couple of cars (not available in-game and has nothing effectively different from what you can purchase on the scenarios' stores) and a Casino that you may earn some cash to buy things. Both are expensive.You may have some fun. It's not a mind-blow. The game has a soft and relaxing mood sometimes due it's soundtrack and the locations chosen. Maybe it was intentional.

Get a complete save game file, the terrible thing about this game is that a full copy does have all the dlc right in your installation but these jokers just made it so you can't use them. Don't rely on the story mode for entertainment for this game. Everything about it is terrible, like it's really bad. Just don't play it.YouTube™ Video: Test Drive Unlimited 2 - The best savegame with all cars (Casino, Club, DLC and wrecked) (PC) Views: 218,534PLEASE, READ! Status: Level 41 (Celebrity) All races completed More than 30 million to spend Several homes to buy Some cars to buy Bonus: a garage with all the Ferraris in Hawaii The following...2. The cockpit view location is terrible as well but there is a simple fix to that problem. There is a camera hack that lets you move the cockpit view to anywhere in the car or simply just a litttle bit farther back to where you are not breathing on the windshield of the car. For this steam version only v1.2 will work, don't get 1.3.http://forum.turboduck.net/threads/28833-StarGT-Hennessey-Venom-GT/page3?p=489925#post4899253. Get the community patch (retail) This should fix most of the problems that the original game developers were too lazy to fix. I like this game but at the same time I'm glad they got fired, this ♥♥♥♥ is gets pretty annoying.http://forum.turboduck.net/threads/30312-TDU2-Unofficial-Patch-v03bThat being said none of this garbage should be done for this game, then again it is a budget game at this point in time. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
y 8, 2014
												Possibly the best racing game out there. The thing that makes this game so much better than the rest is the freedom you get. The world is massive, containing two islands; Ibiza and Hawaii, both with full asphalt and dirt roads, so if driving on paved roads gets a little boring, you can change it up a bit and go offroading. There are quite a few cars in the game, which means that there is a fair amount of variety when choosing your car(s). There are a few problems with the game. There is no option for a clutch without a racing wheel, so you can only go automatic or sequential. I highly recommend getting a gamepad because some of the cars will slide about with the arrow keys. Also when compared to Test Drive Unlimited (prequel), the police in this are suicidal. In TDU they simply try to surround you and bring you to the side of the road, whereas in this the objective is to ram you until you are stuck between a tree and 3 cops, and have to give up.Otherwise the game is brilliant. Definitely recommend buying it if you are into racing games.
