content:
er 25, 2013
												I play a lot of driving games across many platforms, and very few legitimately anger me like this one does. The physics are horrible, each group of cars feels the same. Whether it's the uncontrollable spinning nature of the Classics, the incredibly light and floaty steering of the Off-Roaders, or the go-anywhere-but-around-corners Exotics. And the challenges, oh man the challenges. You'll find yourself exclusively playing the car loan challenges only because A: The ygive you an incredibly unbalanced amount of cash, and B: because it keeps you away from the other challenges that will make you drive your mouse and keyboard (and gamepad if you own one) into the monitor as hard as you can. Like the challenge that requires you to drive a drunk woman home, where first gear alone will fill the meter by half, and the turns will take the rest.It wouldn't be so bad if the game had some variety, some sort of life to it, like it's predecessor did. But in this it just feels like they carbon copied the last game and then poorly redid the main functions of it. Hell, it has the island from the last game, but having two islands causes them both to feel empty, due to spreading out the game across the two, and lazy, due to the two islands not really having much to diffferentiate in terms of scenery and road design. (You would think that Hawaii and Ibiza would be a little bit more diffrent, if only to justify having both islands)In the end, the game will frustrate you and make you wish you'd just bought something else with your £15. I've played a lot of driving games, and this is honestly one of the very worst.Not as bad as Big Rigs, but that has it's own category...

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
9, 2013
												These two open world race titles have much together, but also much differences. And will The Crew be as good as Test Drive? Find it out in this review.________MAP_________In TDU 2 you have two maps: Hawaii and Ibiza. You unlock Hawaii after 10 levels. What I have to say about the maps in TDU 2 is: They are vacationish. More about that in the Graphics comparision, but let me say one thing: garish colors all over the map. In TDU you also have pretty much the same look everywhere. In The Crew you will be able to drive through several stuff like (real big) cities, deserts, mountains etc... So that is a point that The Crew wins.Both games have huge maps. In Test Drive the map is a bit smaller though and, as I said, splitted in two pieces, so The Crew wins in general.The Crew 1 : 0 TDU 2______STICKERSHOP_______The Sticker shop of TDU 2 is great. You can choose different stickers (like out of 150!) and turn and place them whereever you wish. Choose colors by yourself, this is just a great content of TDU. The only bad thing I know about it, and it is very bad, is that the car and older sticker become more and more fuzzy when you add more stickers.THe Sticker shop of The Crew is not completely finished, but you can test the pre-alpha at their website and I have to say: Wow, good job already, Ubisoft! It has pretty much the same functions as the TDU one, though not so many stickers yet, and some nice "import" functions.All in all these two games are most probably the games with the best stickershops until now.Draw!The Crew 1 : 0 TDU 2______TUNING______TDU 2 has to stand back in the Tuning category though. The only things you can do are: Level 1-3 Brakes, level 1-3 Speed, level 1-3 acceleration and some different wheels. In The Crew you can tune everything, every little bit of your car. Look at these preorder boni: http://thecrew-game.ubi.com/portal/de-DE/order/index.aspxThere are tunings avaiable for interior, tencers, skirts, motor hood, rear wings and even side mirrors. Not to speak of the whole in-car techniques. Motor, Tires, Suspers, weight, chasis etc etc. And the car looks completly different depending on in which mode you drive it. This is a completly clear win for The Crew!The Crew 2 : 0 TDU 2____MULTIPLAYER_____Both of these games are multiplayer games. In both you mainly drive online, but also have the opportunity to drive offline. But in The Crew it works out better. As the name of the game already says: "The Crew". You drive in a crew, hopefully out of friends, otherwise out of AIs. But the options to play with your friends (that I could test out at Gamescom already) are just much better in The Crew. Though both games do not have any loading screens it is slightly easier to handle the menues for online play in The Crew.Moreover the servers of The Crew will most likely be online longer. Take a look at other Ubisoft games: still a good connection. Take a look at Test Drive: Servers already offline! And the best thing about that: the game still tries to connect with Atari, so many people can not play their game anymore at all. Because of that bug I would even like to give a minus point to TDU (guess whose copy does not run anymore), but I do not know how many people actually have that issue, so I am just going to call it a Draw again.The Crew 2 : 0 TDU 2______CONTROLS_______In both games you can use your keyboard, a Controller or a Racing wheel. And I have to praise TDU, because you can even use an H-Shifter as controller, but Ubisoft did not give me any information than the ones I found out myself, so I think I am going to call it a Draw again.The Crew 2 : 0 TDU 2______GRAPHICS______Okay, compare a 2011 old-gen game to a 2014 next-gen game. Of course the 2014 one looks better. But what I personally like about Test Drive is: Everything creates a feeling of vacation, bright colors, many many trees and palms, beautiful sun settings. The Crew looked more like Driver San Fransisco looks. Serious and hard. And in my opinion the graphics of Test Drive is still perfectly alright (ok, I

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
y 24, 2014
												I've not even played half an hour of this game but I'm afraid I can already tell you that I can't recommend it. That's not me being spiteful or anything either, because I loved TDU1 on PSP and PS2.It's mostly technical issues. Thankfully, the game does support controllers, although not automatically; you have to enable this from the settings.The first thing you'll notice upon booting up the game is that it only runs in windowed mode. F11 and the maximise button did not fix this, and although there was an option to change the resolution in the settings, there was no fullscreen option. I'm not sure if it's me being mad, but full games running in windowed mode tend to result in choppier framerates, and that was certainly the case here.Then we have the car handling itself. The tiniest of braking will send you spinning out of control for no reason whatsoever. It makes the game unplayable. It was the same in both the high-end Ferrari care the game teases you with in the beginning (which was really just slow and spinny), and with the starter car you buy.Furthermore, when in first person mode the mouse sensitivity is extremely slow, even when set to the highest possibility in the settings.I would advise against buying.

My drivers are up to date and there is no possible cause for this problem, I don't know if it is to do with Nvidia but just don't buy this game.

												This game is terrible. I did not go through enough of the reviews before I bought this one. When I originally read about it, people were saying that the customization was great even though it's not strictly a simulation driver/racer... Even if this game were free, I would have deleted it after 5 minutes of play. This game would have been entertaining back in the mid 90s... however as a release for 2011... 3 fuggin years ago... this is a public abortion of epic proportion... I tried Test Drive games before, like 15 years ago, and was disappointed, I don't know who slipped me a mickey to convince me that this might be worth anything...

content:
ry 26, 2014
												The least amount of fun you can have for $50.Lame gameplay with endless ramblings about clubs and lifestyles. Uninspiring driving, worse than TDU1.Update:Ok, so now that I have played the game a bit there is not much else to say, the good parts of TDU1 (driving feel etc) are worse and the bad parts (clubs, lifestyle, yada yada) are in the foreground.To even suggest that this game has any meaningful racing wheel support is beyond me (I have a G27). The clutch is implemented as a binary switch which just makes it utterly useless. It is hard (want to say impossible but that would be a bit harsh) to configure a wheel as all the settings are either inverted or just meaningless. It is impossible to get the wheel in the car to match the motion of the controller, perhaps this causes the loose feeling in steering, or perhaps it is just the non existant FFB. The UI is bad (console port), the sounds are mediocre and sometimes bugged (windows open and, voila: no change, AI cars sometimes have little/no sound). The cutscenes can be skipped, but the in-game dialogue still has enough "charisma" to make you want to punch the monitor.  The biggest mystery of the MOOR-genre is why Atari nuked FFB support for TDU1 and shut down the servers in favor of this abortion.

Once I get these cars, I don't care about going further in the game, I just drive them around and that's it, I don't need anything else.The game still crashes quite often.And the most annoying thing: many best cars are locked behind a pay wall. content:
y 3, 2014
												+++ Expansive environments with plenty of variety.+++ Large selection of cars.--- Spotty and unpredictable driving physics.--- Inferior graphical optimization.--- Awful voice acting.--- Disengaging story.--- Is the game server down?  Then you are out of luck.There is something to be said of a game that remains wholly incompatible with a recent computer for a full year and a half before it agrees to work with the latest video card drivers.  This is only the first of several problems.TDU2 seems to have somewhat lost itself into attempting to be an experience of playing a rich man and his toys, with racing itself taking the backseat.  It's one that does not pass very well in concept let alone in practice: the result is a player character who by a strange stroke of luck gets pulled into a would-be reality TV show featuring spoiled rich brats with a short temper, and it appears the plot's hook is to antagonize the player as much as possible.  Much work appears to have been done into rendering the interior of homes and shops, features that are ultimately inconsequential and appear superfluous in the grand scheme.On the road, things are hit and miss.  Some cars hold on to the asphalt well enough while others - much like it's been in TDU1 - slip and slide to such a degree as to make them undriveable.  Jumps are handled in a wholly unpredictable way, with several of them resulting in the car coming to a sudden stop or flipping over.  The racer AI is basic at best and wholly uncompetitive at worst - though curiously, time attack stages are noticeably difficult.The game will go down as a poorly ported bargain bin racer that might attract the eyes while on sale, but fact remains that for a few dollars more, it is possible to grab a much more polished racing game.

content:
r 25, 2014
												Pros: Maps are huge, Honolulu should be unlocked from the start though.Car customization is very good. It's not quite as good as in the Forza games.Very good car selection, ranging from an Alfa MiTo to Bugatti Veyron to Koenigsegg CCXRCons:The way the cars handle makes me thing they weren't finished yet when they released the game.You need to buy motorbikes with real money.The story isn't that good.It gets very repetitive very quickly.The license system in the game doesn't make any sense.Too much DRMSteering wheel support is rubbish. It has it but you have to spend hours setting it up properly.If you can get it working and you have some friends who have this, it can be very fun online. If you don't have friends who own this game, it's not worth buying unless it's 80% off or something.

content:
er 21, 2013
												Cruising around with your friends or on your own is about as much fun as you will get out of this game. This game is a deep disappointment in comparison to the first game. The game really feels arcadish and boring. The driving is simply horrible even for an arcade game and the physics engine is horrificly terrible. The first game was actually really great, but this is just a plain and simple diaster. Online play seems completley broken and rarely works in my expirience yet when you do get online it can be fun for a short while.This has to be one of the worst racing games I have ever played and I reccomend staying away from this.

content:
, 2014
												I really wanted to put a lot of time into this game but for 3 reasons I'll probably never play it again.1. God Damn Awful Physics: The physics in this game are just horrible. Every time I make a turn I spin out of control.2. Ridiculous Driving Tests: The driving tests in this game are so crappy. There isn't even a need for them.3. Bad Story and voice acting: There is almost never a story in a racing game, but when there is one it should be good. In this game they should have just removed the whole story and just made it a simple racing game. But they didn't and now it just makes the game worse. With a terrible story, terrible lines, and bad voice acting it just butchers the entire game.Overall this is one of the worst games I've ever played.

content:
, 2015
												Before I start I just want to point out a few things, I have written two reviews, one for the faint-hearted and one for those who really care. Also I have played TDU 1 and 2 and I can say for sure that TDU 1 is much better.Short summary:It's a horrible game with many bugs and glitches. The gameplay is boring and it's impossible to win a race in the later stages and before I forget THE SAVEFILE RANDOMLY GETS CORRUPT AFTER YOU PLAY FOR 40 HOURS. So the conclusion of this review, do NOT buy this game if you don't want to waste your life on a ♥♥♥♥ arcade racing game. Pros: should I even botherCons: the whole gameDetailed review:This game is badly optimized and in some places unplayable. Tabbing out is an exampel of how ♥♥♥♥ this game is, and it is like the developers didn't want you to play it at all sometimes when the game doesn't start. The story is the worst I have ever seen, the driving licenses are very difficult  to get and the championships are unrealistic, also the driving can't be more arcade, it feels like you are driving a boat. Multiplayer is the only fun part about this game, that is when it works of course, the game has a tedious server feature wich makes you join your friend, most of the time this does not work. The only other good thing I think is the selection of cars, there are many different cars and car dealers, with three types of different cars, asphalt, classic and off-road. I personally think off-road is the best and has the most realistic feel. Pros: - Multiplayer - Car selectionCons: - Badly optimized- Unrealistic driving- ♥♥♥♥ story

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
er 5, 2016
												Runs poorly, takes forever to load, Gamplay is boring.Good luck trying to get this game to run.The game has a seperate launcher which takes about two minutes to check my NAT type and allow me to click the play button. Performance is inconsistant. Game ran okay the first time I played, until I went to play the next day only to find the game lagging and stuttering regardless of what settings I used.Gamepleay wise its pretty mediocre for a racing game. The driving is boring and feels almost sluggish and arcade like. The actual car sounds are flat and boring, and the voice acting is cringe worthy.I would not reccomend this game. There are better driving games out there.

content:
, 2011
												A realistic driving game with insane graphics and nice cars, too! I especially like the gameplay and storyline, with the parts where you just walk around like it's The Sims included. They finally gave an explanation for why you would get money for passing by other cars closely, or jumping in the air with your car, and it's a pretty reasonable one too, so that's cool! I was affraid this would be some cheap console port, and even though the accept button is green, the cancel button is red, and there is also a blue and a yellow button, I really like the gameplay and the controls are fully customizable. I ordered a Microsoft Wireless Receiver for XBOX360 controller to try with this game, because I miss the analog steering, but besides that, it's an awesome game!

content:
r 10, 2014
												I really cannot recommend this game. Yes you are getting a lot for your money, Two huge Islands with hundreds of Kilometres of Road, many different cars and bikes, a lot of different clothing, many houses which you can ecplore freely, Day and Night cycle, Weather effects which actually affect the Handling. However that is the problem. The Handling. The cars just feel very very sloppy. Some of them are simply uncontrollable. And no matter how many features a Racing game has, the most essential thing is the feeling of the cars. There is no sense of speed in this game. 250 kph feel exactly the same as 150 kph. The Engine sounds are basically all the same, just pitched higher or lower. The cars don't sound like cars, more like a kid saying VRROOOOOM VVVVRRRROOOOM. Another problem is the "Story". Each and every Character in this game is annoying as hell. They are all arrogant and rich ♥♥♥♥♥♥ who basically do nothing else than show of how much money they have. It's just completely unnecessary. Also the cops are... well.. they are there, but they don't do anything. Pass them by with 300+ kph, they won't give a ♥♥♥♥. Ram into civilian cars right next to them, they won't care. Even if you ram straight into them nothing is going to happen. A Search Level Bar fills, but they won't come after you until it is full, which is next to impossible to achieve. And even if you do get them to come after you, you will lose them very quickly, as they are just really really stupid and slow. I advise you to keep away from this Game and invest your Money elsewhere.

content:
ry 1, 2012
												The driving model of this game is somewhere between Arcade, Realism and WTF??  But that does not hinder me from playing it. The Open World, Apartments and tons of customizations invite you to waste some time in this game. What I don't like, however, is that you are forced to drive on every road to raise your exploration level in order to be able to Tune. It also does not have any cloud support nor is your character stored on a server which makes it a major pain to loose your save in that game. It is also a pita to play together with friends, because only 6 people at once are allowed in one instance of the islands Ibiza and Hawaii. But still, it is a good game with some minor flaws and if you can look beyond that, it is fun.

												I want to like this game. I really do! But it isn't even fun. My main problems are that you have to download an extra 1 GB of the game via launcher. I have 8 hours put into the game mainly because of the damn extra GB they make you install. Also, the graphics are horribly outdated, even when it launched. With maximum settings, the game still looks like absolute ♥♥♥♥. The framerate stays around 30 FPS, even on the lowest setting. DO NOT, I REPEAT, DO NOT GET THIS GAME! It'll waste your time. content:
, 2016
												I am writing this out because I am so unhappy with this waste of my money... I read the reviews but I saw enough good ones to have enough hope in a good game. But I was wrong. This game is absolutely impossible to drive in, and the story is just a mess. I was hoping for and improvement on TDU1, which was already pretty good, but it really was a letdown! It took me hours to set my controls to be acceptable with a Logitech F710 Wireless Gamepad (which is an xBox 360 Gamepad mimic) . And that was just barely acceptable. That struggle was soon forgotten when I had to deal with the HORRID handling. Now, I've played enough racing games, and done enough driving IRL to know that this isn't how it should work. I haven't even gotten past the beginning "racing school" that unlocks the rest of the game. I gave up after MANY tries . Not to mention the terrible framerate, also contributing to the horrible driving characteristics. Overall, this game is a complete letdown and a total waste of money. I really do hate to say it because it had so much potential to be amazing.

content:
ry 12
												This game is amazing, despite what others say. I originally played TDU2 on the PS3 and I loved the game, so I came back to it on PC. I don't know why people are saying the servers don't work, because they work for me. I also don't get why people are saying it won't open up all you have to do is wait for it to connect to your Wi-Fi and press "Start". Pros - The game has got an amazing open world which is full of houses, car dealerships and much more to explore. There are two main islands, Ibiza and Hawaii. The story is exciting as you earn more money through out the game, so you can buy houses and new cars. TDU2 is perfect for going on roadtrips around the islands! It's just a beutiful game which I've had so many memories playing on PS3 and that will continue on PC. Cons - Once on the PS3 the game deleted my data, I'm not sure if this happens on PC, but just be aware. I would also wait for this game to go on sale because it is a bit pricey for a game that is 6 years old. The controlls on a keyboard and mouse is like playing a game of twister, so I'd recomend buying a gamepad (preferably a Logitech F710 Wireless Gamepad). The handling is quite annoying on TDU2 because every time you brake (even gently) while turning, you spin out or lose controll, this is more prominent with more powerful cars. The devs have abandoned on this game because Eden Games have shutdown due to their workers going on strike. TDU3 has been officially announced by another company called BigBen Interactive who have made the newer WRC games. I just hope they put a bit more work into TDU3 than Eden Games did with TDU2, then it would be a more polished game.But I do recommend this game.

er 27, 2011
												I like this game.Feels really realistic and it's fun to drive in an open-world with other people on the internet.You earn your own money and buy cars/flats/buildings with it. Of course the other players can see what you have. You can even change your clothes, you can walk around inside dealers, paint/tune your car and whatnot.Sometimes I had to force myself to take a break, it can be somewhat addictive :DThe most impressive experience gives you a steering wheel (+manual shifting and clutch). I'm also using three monitors which gives the edge.A new DLC will soon be released, too.Graphics wise it's pretty good but not exellent. The sounds, especially the engine sounds are one of the bigger disappointments. The music is cool but there is a serious lack of songs in the radio.I haven't even done many races yet, lol. There's different ways to earn money and discovering the world is also coolIf you like driving/racing/cruising and what I explained above, this game is for you

content:
9, 2014
												Test Drive Unlimited 2 – This is one of my favourite games. After spending over 1000 hours playing this on Xbox and then getting it on PC it is still a great game. There are a wide variety of cars you can get but unlike the first Test Drive Unlimited it doesn't have Lamborghini’s which where a very popular car for people. The sticker shop is awesome, with some of the designs that come out of there on people's cars it is just unreal, in fact I have a friend who is an artist and has made cars within the game which are beyond belief. The 2 maps are huge and I like the fact that they kept the first Test Drive map in and added a new one so there is Ibiza and Hawaii and to drive on everyone road would take you forever because of the size of the maps, you could play for 24 hours straight and still not cover every road. You meet a lot of nice people, in my opinion the community isn't half bad but there is a lot of Russian people and German people etc. There are a few problems with the game which are that it is a little glitchy, I don't think this game gets updated because there is nothing ever new or that has changed. Also the DLC can't be bought through Steam which makes it harder for some of us to get because you have to buy it through Atari's website. A major downside is that the contract agreed is that the TDU2 servers have to stay up for the next 3 years (to around 2017 as far as I know) and a lot of people are in agreement that they will be down near enough straight away after the contract is up.I highly recommend this game because there isn't many free-roam driving games that I know of, they are mostly all racing. If you can get a friend to get this aswell as you then you will probably enjoy it a lot more. If you wait to get it in the sales then it will be really worth it but either way you should get it.

												Enjoyable racing game. Features the islands of Ibiza and Hawaii, which means plenty of roads to race on! Or instead of racing the races you could of course just do some relaxing sightseeing, test drive the cars you can't afford (yet), replace the furniture in your house or get cosmetically adjusted. Yes, this game also has some Sims-like aspects lol, but fortunately these are, as far I can tell with only 9 hours in, only aesthetic. Oh and you play online 'by default', making the game kind of MMO. This makes it easy to play races vs other players, since (in non-race mode) they are always driving around in the same world anyway.

content:
er 21, 2013
												TDU-2Well where to start with this game,I used to own TDU-1 on the X-Box-360, and really liked the idea and concept that was behind the game.Right CONS first.CONS1st. You HAVE to create an account with Atari "No Biggie Really"2nd. You also have to start with the keyboard at the begining."By the time i had to go to my garage to see my present i was buried in the menus straight away by hitting the escape key." finally got to the controler part. although once i had accepted the change of layout things did seem to get better.3rd. To be honest and fair to the game i didnt even make it to my Garage "YET"4th. Monitor resolution, Most games give you the option to change it with the little window that opens to launch the game. I had to go in the menu's to find the correct settings5th. Having to download an additional 1.6/7GB's of data at the launch of the game. "Was Pretty Quick Though"PROS1st. The game does seem to look really good. "Cant comment on the cars YET as not been playing long enough"2nd. The sheer amount of cars. "Some of the top manufacturers"3rd. The fun side, you can have some really good crazy times playing this game with friends.That is all i have got for now but i will update it as i play through the game and progress, just to give a fair review, I have not even drove a car yet on this game, but being in the sale i would honestly say that yes i would reccomend this game to a friend and that i will more than likely enjoy playing this game, "ONCE YOU GET YOUR HEAD AROUND THE MENU'S & SETTINGS & PUTTING THEM RIGHT" that is.Cheersmark117hEdit : 22/12/2013 @ 20:38 Hrs.###UPDATE###Now that i have finally had a chance to be able to have an hour on this game, i can give an honest and proper review of it of sorts.I am currently using a controller that is like the x-box - 360's only its from madcatz i think and its got turbo mode, i was actually quite surprised at how ok the handling was using this as believe me i cant use a keyboard to play games to save my life and to be honest with you i HATE controllers normally in a racing/driving type of game.  I have the microsoft 360 wireless racing wheel and i love using it in my driving games especially driving with no aids on.My point is that the game is not bad at all in the handling with the controller, although it does show in Big Picture mode that the controller is not supported, well it is as i have been using one.Another thing is the cars WOW they look really polished and quite realistic and full of details, you can tell that Atari have put a lot of love into it.The island seems to be a real large area full of backwoods and motorways as well as some nice city scapes as well.So far i have not tryed the online multiplayer side of it, for fear of looking a T#*t, not being that good with a controller that is.Overall i would still say i would reccomend this game to friends and family alike, and yes i would rate it a decent game, as long as the price is a decent one, i got it in the sale so i cant really moan about that, but all in all i am happy with this purchase.Cheersmark117h

												I do not recommend  this as a racing game, i recommend this as a car game. By that i mean the driving isn't 100% and the force feed back (if you are using a wheel) is weak. However you can earn money buy loads of houses and hundreds of cars. If you look hard enough you can find a club with a maxium of 30 players. For me this is the ideal game. You get to live in this huge world and cruise hundreds of miles with freinds. You can buy funiture for your houses, cloths for you character. Unlike tdu1 you can actaully walk around buildings. You can buy dlc cars and a dlc called casino which alows you to play casino games with other players and gives you a chance to win rare items. Two cars also come with this dlc, Audi r8 spyder and a Spyker spyder. You can buy them or win them.I'm more than happy with my purchase that i made over a year ago. I joined a club met lots of freinds and bough lots and lots and lots of cars ;)Hope you enjoy the game.

content:
y 28, 2014
												A simulator that is actually fun.As long as you care less about story and voice acting, this game is like that one computer next to the paint isle at Lowes or Home Depot and crap. You go to your "house" and you can change the wall color and chairs and other misc. furnishing. Nuff said about the primary features, this marvelous work of code has a built in driving mini game where you work your way to the top with the big boys of racing. Atari really knocked it out of the park, and totally dissed eden for trying to ruin it, thankfully due to fan rage the opeining sequence was kept in the game, but was reduced to 2 fps for space concerns. The in game music is totally hype, and I personally recomend you keep it off due to the overwhelming ammount of new age/ generation of pop culture itself, let alone talent. You can tell this game was directed towards enviromentalists, after all, if you run at 256 miles per hour into a leaf from any plant the car will spontainously stop without harm to any living thing, allowing you to reflect on your terrible driving as your arch rivals pass, leaving you in dead last your greivous actions towards nature and virtual self. Your level can depend on several factors based on whatever the heck you feel fit. You can go through the game like a normal person and work on competition, which is basically just winning races and crap. If that does not appeal to you, you can also discover things on the 2 islands the game lets you play on. Since Test Drive Unlimited 2 is real life, if you want to take a backroad across Hawaii, it takes a real life 2 hours to do so, making discovery the slowest progressing level. There is also collection, which expalins itself, rewarding you for hoarding as much luxury items as possible. Finally there is Social, which even after reading a wikipedia article, I cannot comprehend the meaning of the word. Screw it, Social is the hardest to progress, since I am still at level 0 :/Final VerdictIs it the most interesting game out there? nopeIs it the most interesting RACING game out there? nopeIs it fun at all? Yeah, it has its moments, expecailly with the car customization.Its pretty good. You should get it, especially only if you have a steering wheel.

												Game seems to work only the first time you install it. After that the problems begin. The game simply "hangs" as a process after the launcher checks the files and you press Play. I managed to play only the first day I installed it and that was it. All the other times it's been trial and error with no luck. It's clearly a Steam issue as the game runs normally if you download a torrent, install the game and use the Steam CD key to make it legit. So until Steam does something about this, my review stands as a "no". 0/10.EDIT 1: Today the game decided to start, so I created an offline account to play. However the overlay menu was blank, no achievements, no game time being registered, no nothing. Of course after I shut down the game and try to rerun it, it didn't start. So -1/10.EDIT 2: I was starting to think my Windows 7 OS was failing the game. I did a clean install of Windows 10 x64 PRO and again the same stupid thing happens when starting the Steam version. So -2/10. PS: The game is awesome and if you really want to buy it, buy it. But to play do what I did: Download the game from a torrent and use the CD key you get from Steam to make it legit. Non Steam version works perfectly, no issues.

												I do not recommend  this as a racing game, i recommend this as a car game. By that i mean the driving isn't 100% and the force feed back (if you are using a wheel) is weak. content:
, 2011
												### Updated to reflect some changes ###This game is not just about racing. It is the ultimate rich ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ simulator. You roll around Ibiza and Hawaii in your supercar and mingle with similar rich ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s - buying expensive clothes, accoutrements, real estate and gambling. You can practcally see the flashing of dollar bills and the glinting of the bleached teeth.The only thing that's missing is the ability to DUI. And that you can fix by roleplaying. Maybe really delve deep into the role and have a few pints or do some rails while playing. Who am I to judge?It's worth mentioning that some 30 minutes into the game a woman named after a Southern US city insulted my taste in fashion. And this happened in a game supposedly about racing cars.### UPDATE: The online features are gone, and most of the DLC content is no longer available (some vehicles and the DLC missions still remain - bikes are all gone though). Still, there's a good chunk of single player content in this. This is still a game that allows you to cruise around on not one, but two sizeable tropical islands in a decent selection of vehicles, ranging from a Golf GTI to a Koeningsegg CCRX with some legendary classics like the Lancia Delta Integrale or the Jaguar E-Type thrown in as well. All of them nicely modeled with fully detailed interiors, which is not a given even in standard titles like Gran Turismo.And folks have even managed to mod new cars into the game (though sadly only through replacing vanilla ones, as far as I know), so for instance if you prefer Lamborghinis to Ferraris, you're all set now! There's also apparently an Unofficial Patch that fixes bugs and adds content, though I haven't tried it. So yeah, this game is like Jason Voorhees. Technically dead, but not down for the count. And still eager to entertain. ###

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
8, 2015
												I did own this game for a short time on PS3 before picking it up again on PC. The UpLauncher is completely redundant and annoying. Takes far too long to do whatever it does just to get the game loaded. This can be replaced with a more streamlined community made launcher that is much faster. The controls and/or physics are comical. The cars feel like bricks on wheels. When it comes to driving, use a controller. Whether it be for a console or PC directly, use it. I did attempt to use a steering wheel and that went nowhere. The cars’ handling becomes twitchy and recalcitrant. There are bits of glitches as expected. Most are ones I experienced on the console version. Gameplay visual performance is well optimized. On an older machine I was able to have a few the settings on High or Very High while most remained on Medium. Behind the scenes performance is lacking. You can easily tell this a port from most likely the XBOX version to PC rather than a full PC build from the start. The basic storyline can be finished in a matter of days. So don’t expect it to last long.Not all is bad! All of the content on the PC is identical to the console versions. There is almost 2,000 miles of open road to explore spread among two islands. There are 176 cars to drive about in ranging from classics to suvs to supercars. Lesser known small time automakers like Ascari and Ginetta are present. There is enough side content to keep you busy in solo or offline mode. (I think the servers a dead now? I can’t seem to get online at all.) The environment is well made and adequate for an arcade racer. If you simply want to cruise an open world and look at scenery, this game fits that well. If you are an avid car fan, there is just something pleasing about saving up to buy that one car you have had your eye on. There is plethora of dream cars to fill your garages with. Engine sounds are decent. Some are less than accurate. Overall, I would suggest this game simply for the open world and car selection. Not for the racing or the story. There is an avid community still present for this game. Improvements and more content can be found via an unofficial patch.

												Test Drive Unlimited 2 (TDU2) is a a great game, it functions like an MMO with a persistant world where you meet other drivers everywhere. Not only does it have alot of cars, but you can buy houses, clothes, haircuts even plastic surgery, so there's enough customization. There's also a club system which is essentially the same as any guild system in other MMO's the clubs reward you with special cars and clothes.And if you care to spend a little extra you can get the casino "expansion" which brings a casino with roulette, poker etc. As well as even more clothes, furniture and cars.The only bad thing I have to say is about the car handling. It's not broken, it's just very hard to get around. But once you *do* get around it, playing TDU2 will be a fun experience, especially if you have some friends whom you can "cruise" Ibiza and Hawaii with!

												Not sure why so many peope having issues with this game. Plays beautifully at max settings for me with a pair of GTX 660s in SLI. Smooth as butter, with Vsync off.Working with my Thrustmaster T150 wheel, with T3PA pedals and a pair of TH8A shifters... one for shifting and the other for handbrake. I was worried about this, since racing games with anything but my racing cockpit simply sucks.I'm connected and being challenged to races by other players. I am declining since I am just learning the game so far and have no upgrades.Love the game, I like the fact that the view turns into corners in cockpit view, something from the old Cross Racing Championship 2005 game that I wish all race games would have. Plenty of cars to choose from. Obviously, they don't handle like a sim but that's not what I bought this game for. Open world cruising like Need For Speed World was with some upgrading of you character elements. Buying new houses, garages, clothes, cosmetically changing your looks, etc. Kinda goofy but kinda cool at the same time.The scales is huge, I had to drive 2 miles to see the cosmetic doctor and it felt like it.Steam Summer sale for the win! Wish I bought it last year when I was thinking about it.

												The original Test Drive Unlimited has been my favorite racing game for years. What I love is that you have the entire island of Oahu to drive around on. You can race in the 4 or 5 different racing modes they offer, but you can also just cruize around the island for literally hours discovering new roads and places. Test Drive Unlimited 2 takes this a step farther, now you start off on the island of Ibiza, and you eventually will be able to unlock the island of Oahu once again. This game is highly, highly recommended.

y 10, 2014
												I love Test Drive Unlimited. It is one of the few games I can think of that invovle a Customizable car, a variety of car choices, and customizing your personal my TDU2 Avatar character in game. I love the game. There are a few design flaws. One of the flaws is apart from the Console versions and the PC is diffrent. One of the things is if you say, bought a car from the PSN as an option, can't have it for PC, another change is the amount of players, there is more or less people who speak English on the consoles then PC. There is also another thing you should be concerned about for the PC vs. Console. One is the number of hackers is on the PC, that cheat on leaderboards, cheat with tanked cars and indestructible cars and infinite cash. Apart from these game flaws, this game is a lot of fun. You can meet a lot of people. You can race others, unlock cars in races or Chase mode. Make a lot of friends and even more personalize yourself with cars, your avatar In game, and buy a number of houses. I only wish if the game was like the previous one, is which you can access the TDU Island or some areas like Casino DLC. All in all, you can say the game is fun and I highly recommend if your not a Need For Speed fan or if you are. I love this game and Need For Speed.

er 5, 2014
												Test Drive Unlimited 2 all about cars (and 3 sport bikes) and roaming around entire island. It's fun , but not realy. It lets you live the life of a pro racer on the Mediterranean island of Ibiza. It combines traditional racing with an open-world, always-online (except when it's not) multiplayer setup that makes it easy to interact with others. You can even buy property on the island, decorate said property, and show off your exotic car collection to your friends. game so much todo but get repetitif sing all you do is driving around and take challenges, from andrenaline, topspeed, time limit, convoi, etc. The portion of the chalange reuse over and over with the same dialogue cutscene.AI doesn't give player any good, they drive slow and easy to beat. Well, You can try to play online and face a real player,but since the connection is poor, and lately server is unknown.(read:today) all you can do is drive around in empty vast island.When it comes to the actual driving, there are just as many conflicting issues. I respect the game's attempt to bridge the gap between arcade-style racing and realistic simulation controls. But ultimately the cars in Test Drive lack the visceral quality that real vehicles possess.  I felt like I was controlling a toy.My self Recommend this to enyone who love cars and driving around island and find collectible, but not recommend to player who seek challlange in race.

9, 2015
												There has been up and downs about this game. I've played this game since the day it came out and played it before steam, I loved the game and the freedom it gives you. You can ride wherever you want on the two islands and exploring is fun, the championships are fun and can be a bit challening sometimes (some races are just too easy). But the thing is that this game is very unstable when it comes to the servers and DLC cars, some months ago the servers were down but now they seem to work perfectly. When it comes to the game itself I like the driving physics, it comes with a realistic feeling and let's not forget the great motorcycle physics. Apart from the driving, the crashing part can be very unrealistic and sometimes when you hit a sidewalk your car can completely stop out of nowhere which will make you very mad. There are plenty of cars to choose from, if you like muscle cars or just sports cars there are plenty of options. The game divides the vehicles into three groups with smaller groups within. A cars, B cars and C cars. A cars are sports/muslce cars and are the fastest vehicles in the game, thus making them my favorite. The B cars are offroad and are stronger cars that has very good offroad handling (apart from A and C cars). C cars are the classics and are older veteran cars which are slower but fun to drive.In summary, this game by date is very fun and I would recommend it for those who love car games and free roam games.

content:
8, 2015
												I did own this game for a short time on PS3 before picking it up again on PC. The UpLauncher is completely redundant and annoying. Takes far too long to do whatever it does just to get the game loaded. This can be replaced with a more streamlined community made launcher that is much faster. The controls and/or physics are comical. The cars feel like bricks on wheels. When it comes to driving, use a controller. Whether it be for a console or PC directly, use it. I did attempt to use a steering wheel and that went nowhere. The cars’ handling becomes twitchy and recalcitrant. There are bits of glitches as expected. Most are ones I experienced on the console version. Gameplay visual performance is well optimized. On an older machine I was able to have a few the settings on High or Very High while most remained on Medium. Behind the scenes performance is lacking. You can easily tell this a port from most likely the XBOX version to PC rather than a full PC build from the start. The basic storyline can be finished in a matter of days. So don’t expect it to last long.Not all is bad! All of the content on the PC is identical to the console versions. There is almost 2,000 miles of open road to explore spread among two islands. There are 176 cars to drive about in ranging from classics to suvs to supercars. Lesser known small time automakers like Ascari and Ginetta are present. There is enough side content to keep you busy in solo or offline mode. (I think the servers a dead now? I can’t seem to get online at all.) The environment is well made and adequate for an arcade racer. If you simply want to cruise an open world and look at scenery, this game fits that well. If you are an avid car fan, there is just something pleasing about saving up to buy that one car you have had your eye on. There is plethora of dream cars to fill your garages with. Engine sounds are decent. Some are less than accurate. Overall, I would suggest this game simply for the open world and car selection. Not for the racing or the story. There is an avid community still present for this game. Improvements and more content can be found via an unofficial patch.

content:
er 11, 2014
												Yes, the Test Drive studio has unfortunately closed, so not sure how well multiplayer interactions function anymore, which was one of this games' stronger selling points. And yes, there are better car renderings and more of them in Gran Turismo. Forza's latest iterations allow more in-depth car customization. TDU2 isn't the most fluid or glitch free title either. But no title does what this one does: combining excellent car exterior and interior rendering, paint customization limited only by your creativity and, most of all, providing a truly vast expanse of roads to free-roam on the islands of Hawaii and Ibiza all in one package. There's even shops to customize your avatar and houses to buy if that's your thing. If you can get past the incredibly lame race introduction dialogue, this game truly has everything and is my favorite free-roam, and actually favorite non-arcade style racing game (sans the GRID series). Would advise creating an offline account and playing it for what it is unless you can verify online modes are still operational.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
y 22, 2015
												Let's get this out of the way: this is a terrible racing game. The driving physics are broken, the cars aren't balanced relative to the classes the game puts them in, vehicle upgrades are extremely generic and there is no tuning whatsoever.Race events range from laughably easy (most races with actual AI racers due to the laughably bad AI) to frustratingly difficult (the time trials where the AI posts amazing times that don't match up at all to their actual racing skill in the races). The game also forces you to go through various licensing challenges to even enter the race events which are a series of frustrating time trials, often in spin-happy RWD cars.If you're looking for a racing sim, stop reading this now and go look elsewhere.As for specifically what wrong with this game:The physics engine heavily favors AWD cars, RWD cars spin out way too easily and its near impossible to recover once that happens. Even the AWD cars will randomly spin out at times, but at least they're more resistant to it and much easier to recover.In most vehicle classes, there is one "I WIN" car that is so much better than all other cars in the class that the others aren't even worth considering for racing.Vehicle upgrades are limited to speed, acceleration, and braking with 4 levels for each. There is no option to tune or put better tires on to try to fix the crazy tailspin on most of the cars.So why did I recommend this game? Simply put, it's an excellent driving game. You have two real world islands to explore, (Ibizia and Oahu) and both are 1:1 scale that completely dwarfs the world in the likes of Forza Horizon. There are plenty of hidden secrets to find and scenic vistas, and a completely free multiplayer free roam where you can randomly encounter other players crusing around and potentially challenge them to a race.There's a few other quirks worth mentioning as well. You have the option to customize your avatar, but no matter what you do they look weird. You also have a limited number of garage spots for new cars and you have to buy new houses to get more which gets very expensive very quickly and is the main financial limiting factor early in the game. The monetary cost of cosmetic things is way high ($300 for a haircut!?!). 5 machine activation limit is unecessary additional drm to be aware of, at least it gives you an activation back if you uninstall it.The game is moddable and there are a few community patches to add new cars and fix some of the issues, but I haven't seen any patches that manage to fully fix all the issues with the game.Overall, I still recommend this game if you enjoy just driving around and exploring more than racing.

content:
8, 2012
												A fully open world massively multiplayer racing simulator that also has character customization is what distinguishes this driving game from the others.The game feels ambitious but tried to juggle too many concepts and ideas at once. Car handling has an arcade feel as compared to other more realistic driving games.It is still fun however mainly due to the game's huge open world in which you can spend hours just lazily cruising along. Exploration is encouraged and rewarding. Graphics are not bad looking. The licensed music included had a nice selection and was a joy to listen to.Multiplayer was a hit and miss. Although i could see other human players, i couldn't see my friend even though we were at the same location. It was a shame as we couldn't drive co-operatively as we had planned. Had it worked well, i would have given it a much higher score.Overall Rating: 6.5 / 10A promising game with flaws. Worth to buy on sale if you are looking for an open world driving game.

content:
er 5, 2014
												Test Drive Unlimited 2 all about cars (and 3 sport bikes) and roaming around entire island. It's fun , but not realy. It lets you live the life of a pro racer on the Mediterranean island of Ibiza. It combines traditional racing with an open-world, always-online (except when it's not) multiplayer setup that makes it easy to interact with others. You can even buy property on the island, decorate said property, and show off your exotic car collection to your friends. game so much todo but get repetitif sing all you do is driving around and take challenges, from andrenaline, topspeed, time limit, convoi, etc. The portion of the chalange reuse over and over with the same dialogue cutscene.AI doesn't give player any good, they drive slow and easy to beat. Well, You can try to play online and face a real player,but since the connection is poor, and lately server is unknown.(read:today) all you can do is drive around in empty vast island.When it comes to the actual driving, there are just as many conflicting issues. I respect the game's attempt to bridge the gap between arcade-style racing and realistic simulation controls. But ultimately the cars in Test Drive lack the visceral quality that real vehicles possess.  I felt like I was controlling a toy.My self Recommend this to enyone who love cars and driving around island and find collectible, but not recommend to player who seek challlange in race.

content:
, 2014
												TDU2 is a stellar game, though a little dated now, it still looks and sounds quite pleasing. If you liked the first TDU, then this is an obvious buy.TDU2 can either be a long slow game or a fast intense game, depending on how you want to play it. There is always plenty to do and exploring is always half the fun. I always suggest driving around and unlocking 75% of the roads in Ibiza's area 2 before you get into the racing scene as this helps with car selection and gives you level 3 performance upgrades for the first few cars you will need (C4, A7, A6 and B4). It takes a decent amount of time just to drive around and unlock roads, but atleast for me it's worth it in the end and you will notice a good diffrence having that level 3 or 4 performance upgrade in those harder races. Level 1/2 upgrades are rarely worth it imo so spend the time and get atleast 75% in Ibiza area 2 right off the bat, then Ibiza 1 and Hawaii 1 (for the high end A1 car's like the Veyron and CCX) later.In the end this is a very addicting racing game that can be intense at times and laid back in others. If you like open world racing games with a plathora of cars from silly hatchbacks to Bugatti's, this one is a no brainer!

r 15, 2014
												Even though it's not a simulation, but more of an arcade racer, TDU2 just sounds, looks and feels good. There is more than enough to do, find, explore and see in single- and multiplayer with a nice mixture of racing events and just relaxing on the road. I just can't mention often enough how relaxing it feels to drive your Ferrari California over one of the beautiful islands.Technically I found very few argue about. The graphics are smooth, the game itself is very stable, everything is nicely configurable and network connections are good as well.If there is something that could be improved, I'd mention a few more (2-3) different mission designs, a bit more life aside from the streets and slightly better player models.So if you think that driving a nice car can be just as good as racing over Ibiza or Oahu with more than 1000 bhp, you might want to check out TDU2.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
, 2014
												I've tried and tried to love this game , and all i come off with is a "sorta like". EDIT: Having played this game a lot more I can say i am at the point where i like it a lot . Maybe its the lack of really compelling car games in recent years but i'd have to say this is one of the better car games out there now. The good: Great open world driving enormous social aspectdeccent (but not the best ) car physicsEDIT: Off road racing The bad:world feels empty compared to the original.  EDIT: it fills empty as  it lacks the ammount of single player racing courses the first game offered. THat said there is stil a lot here.  There are a hella lot of MP courses. Lack of American cars that were in the first game (seriously WTF the only corvette is a DLC one????!!! that's my favorite car period). EDIT: Don't get me wrong there are a good offering on american cars but they only make up about a 1/4th the cars in the game where the original TDU it was 50/50 , and yes some of the beter american cars are DLC. The largest portion of the  purely social aspect is also DLC (i'm looking at you casino) Lacks the  easy to set up user radio station  the first game had and in my opinion the games default stations blow.  EDIT: Requires Atari Tokens to buy DLC, and they only accept paypal as a method for purchase. EDIT: Those god @#$% driving test will have you yanking out your hair. In General I've been some what disapointed with racing games this past few years. This game being one of those.  Its not a bad game but it did disapoint i was hoping for better.  I give this game  a 6.5 out of 10, there is some fun to be had but if you played the first one don't expect much out of this one.  EDIT: all that said  I give the game a revised score of 7.5 , it's worth the purchase.

												Is this game fun? ♥♥♥♥ yeah.Is it a driving simulator? ♥♥♥♥ no.The very definition of an arcade style racer. The driving is extremely satisfying and fun, but surely not realistic.The fact that you get a character/avatar that you can customize, get a house to store your cars, and can upgrade all of it, is great fun. Finally a reason to keep racing, and a fun one at that. You can walk through the car dealerships and look at cars, like what you see? Take it for a Test Drive not so Unlimited (since you get 2 minutes to test it). All in all a great experience to drive around the sunny Ibiza and Hawaii in exotic cars, or crappy ones, because you can get those too.Not all without trouble though, the game comes with a bit of a manual, but not one you can read. To get it to work might take some time (Or none at all, if you're lucky). But its all worth it.

												I love Test Drive Unlimited. It is one of the few games I can think of that invovle a Customizable car, a variety of car choices, and customizing your personal my TDU2 Avatar character in game. I love the game. There are a few design flaws. One of the flaws is apart from the Console versions and the PC is diffrent. One of the things is if you say, bought a car from the PSN as an option, can't have it for PC, another change is the amount of players, there is more or less people who speak English on the consoles then PC. There is also another thing you should be concerned about for the PC vs. Console. One is the number of hackers is on the PC, that cheat on leaderboards, cheat with tanked cars and indestructible cars and infinite cash. Apart from these game flaws, this game is a lot of fun. You can meet a lot of people. You can race others, unlock cars in races or Chase mode. Make a lot of friends and even more personalize yourself with cars, your avatar In game, and buy a number of houses. I only wish if the game was like the previous one, is which you can access the TDU Island or some areas like Casino DLC. All in all, you can say the game is fun and I highly recommend if your not a Need For Speed fan or if you are. I love this game and Need For Speed.

												59 hours on record?... wow no way. I remember playing this game, but not that much. I must have had it minimized for about half of those hours.This game was really fun, and for most of us that will never own any car better than an El Camino - this is the only place where you can feel some semi-real physics for specific car makes and models. y 10, 2015
												#updateThe things written below are still true, BUT the guys of eden were not able to fix one of the most relevant patches from TDU 1 - the save game corruption bug, which still occurs quite often and ♥♥♥♥s up a whole profile with potentially hours of gameplay beeing lost. Therefore I reconsidered recommendation to "no"#When TDU 2 was released in first place it got a lot of mediocore reviews from the gaming sites and also from community. Driving physics, network issues and also the graphics engine were low-rated aspects in the opinion of many. Back then I didn't buy the game despite the fact that I *loved* TDU 1.Now I actually bought the game and can state, that it lives up to its predecessor.TDU 2 is once again - as the name says - centered around cruising with all kinds of want-to-have cars in a beautiful environment. The driving doesn't actually feel like what other driving simulators tell us how driving such cars should feel like. Changing the assistance level doesn't change that. But thats not a problem in my opinion. I totally have a good time on Ibiza island. Graphics are nice but not overwhelming. Story mode is okay. Race modes are fun and the driving licences have been somewhat challenging so far. I am looking forward doing the huge amount of tasks and races, filling my growing numbers of estates with fancy cars and exploring the island via its roads and offsite tracks.Totally worth buying it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
, 2011
												### Updated to reflect some changes ###This game is not just about racing. It is the ultimate rich ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ simulator. You roll around Ibiza and Hawaii in your supercar and mingle with similar rich ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s - buying expensive clothes, accoutrements, real estate and gambling. You can practcally see the flashing of dollar bills and the glinting of the bleached teeth.The only thing that's missing is the ability to DUI. And that you can fix by roleplaying. Maybe really delve deep into the role and have a few pints or do some rails while playing. Who am I to judge?It's worth mentioning that some 30 minutes into the game a woman named after a Southern US city insulted my taste in fashion. And this happened in a game supposedly about racing cars.### UPDATE: The online features are gone, and most of the DLC content is no longer available (some vehicles and the DLC missions still remain - bikes are all gone though). Still, there's a good chunk of single player content in this. This is still a game that allows you to cruise around on not one, but two sizeable tropical islands in a decent selection of vehicles, ranging from a Golf GTI to a Koeningsegg CCRX with some legendary classics like the Lancia Delta Integrale or the Jaguar E-Type thrown in as well. All of them nicely modeled with fully detailed interiors, which is not a given even in standard titles like Gran Turismo.And folks have even managed to mod new cars into the game (though sadly only through replacing vanilla ones, as far as I know), so for instance if you prefer Lamborghinis to Ferraris, you're all set now! There's also apparently an Unofficial Patch that fixes bugs and adds content, though I haven't tried it. So yeah, this game is like Jason Voorhees. Technically dead, but not down for the count. And still eager to entertain. ###

Take it for a Test Drive not so Unlimited (since you get 2 minutes to test it). All in all a great experience to drive around the sunny Ibiza and Hawaii in exotic cars, or crappy ones, because you can get those too.Not all without trouble though, the game comes with a bit of a manual, but not one you can read. To get it to work might take some time (Or none at all, if you're lucky). But its all worth it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
r 26, 2015
												Well, it is a mixed bag. The game gets a few things right really well, and really messes up some other parts. It is not a racing game for fanatics looking for realism and special racing cars on special circuits. This is a casual racer, but I think there are games in that genre that handles better like NFS Hot Pursuit 2 and Burnout Paradise (the best game still).AND, the online never really works. I think it has been abandoned for a while actually. I do recommend it even if there is no online. If you do care about online then obviously forget this one. Oh, and play with a 360-controller. It just does not work very well with any other option if you want to do well. I tried with a steering-wheel too, and it made everything worse even though lots of fun. What is great? The idea of driving around freely on an island is fantastic. If you actually want to drive more "normal" cars on the road and not just race in circles this is the game for you. You can play the game like Truck simulator 2 if you wish, just driving around, enjoying the scenery and your cars. Even if that is very simple, the game does this part extremely well. The cars look great, the island(s) look great. Lots of freedom. Nice weather. You can buy nice houses and fix your car. Great cockpit view for immersion. There is quite a lot to do on the island(s). Lots of nice cars to try. The races are ok, and there is a welcome addition of off-road driving that is probably the most fun in the game. More on that later.What is not too great? They whole story mode is just incredibly silly and forced. Every cut-scene feels written by a person who couldn't smell funny even if it would be served on a silver platter under their nose, but has rather looked up the word funny on the internet and plastered a bunch of horrible cliches together. Everything feels forced and is rather embarrassing. And the voice-overs are sooo bad. They are just trying too hard, making it sound incredibly unnatural and disconnected. "Look, I'm so happy and crazy!!!!!" They audio is also so repetitive that it becomes ridiculous and has nothing to do with the situation you are in. It really feels like they hired the cheapest voice talent with absolutely no previous experience except for perhaps unemotional robots. The radio is the same. Some good music and some interesting ideas, but they are not funny, at all... Compared to GTA-radio it is just embarrassing. And what is up with the people on this island? They all look like they come from the movie the Stepford Wives. It is downright creepy actually. The vision between the "car-game" and the "world" seems like two different planets. This corporate ugly plastic vision with no taste or style destroys the game.The sounds of the cars are really bad. Especially the SUVs. The devs just did not try at all here. They sound nothing like a real car, just a like cheap synth pitched up and down. Really surprising when you consider the details in the rest of the game.And, DLCs for extra cars...RacesSo, the challenges are ok, fun and varied but I HATE the time trials. I HATE them!!!! Because it is totally unforgiving. I don't mind that there is a challenge but it makes no sense the way it is set-up this game. In normal races you can mess up, and catch up the others, the race is not over if you make ONE small mistake. But in the time trials, you better just start over if you mess up. This becomes more hairpullingly annoying when some of the time trials are 5 minutes long and you make a mistake at the end of that track and you have to start over. And every time you start over you have to see an annoying cut-scene. To make you scream a bit more they also added a game-mechanic that is just there to slap you in the face: On time trials, if you drive off the road just even slightly, a timer starts ticking, removing time from your total!!!! I understand the reason: they thought that you should not be able to cheat by taking a shortcut, but the fact is that the cars handle so poorly off-road that it would never be a good option to do so anyway. You gain nothing by driving off-road, your car slows down a lot AND you get punished for it as well time-wise. There is also a challenge where you have to drive around the entire island, which takes about 50 minutes. Actually a rather neat idea if you  have the time for it. Here, I think they realized the problem I am talking about because it is fairly easy to do that one and have plenty of time left, but I wish the time trials were a little easier. They are just frustrating as it is.The game has good FPS in general but I have to say that the 3D-engine is not greatly optimized and you will not get a great performance if your computer is a little older. Lots of pop-ins and stutter unless you don't mind lowering the quality quite a but. Many games do a lot better.Despite all the negativity I like the game in the end. It is the only game that does what it does, and the good parts it does rather well. I do recommend it on a sale. You do get a lot even though the online does not work. I have enjoyed it, except for the need to vomit every time the cut-scenes come in.

content:
er 5, 2014
												Test Drive Unlimited 2 all about cars (and 3 sport bikes) and roaming around entire island. It's fun , but not realy. It lets you live the life of a pro racer on the Mediterranean island of Ibiza. It combines traditional racing with an open-world, always-online (except when it's not) multiplayer setup that makes it easy to interact with others. You can even buy property on the island, decorate said property, and show off your exotic car collection to your friends. game so much todo but get repetitif sing all you do is driving around and take challenges, from andrenaline, topspeed, time limit, convoi, etc. The portion of the chalange reuse over and over with the same dialogue cutscene.AI doesn't give player any good, they drive slow and easy to beat. Well, You can try to play online and face a real player,but since the connection is poor, and lately server is unknown.(read:today) all you can do is drive around in empty vast island.When it comes to the actual driving, there are just as many conflicting issues. I respect the game's attempt to bridge the gap between arcade-style racing and realistic simulation controls. But ultimately the cars in Test Drive lack the visceral quality that real vehicles possess.  I felt like I was controlling a toy.My self Recommend this to enyone who love cars and driving around island and find collectible, but not recommend to player who seek challlange in race.

content:
9, 2016
												Not sure why so many peope having issues with this game. Plays beautifully at max settings for me with a pair of GTX 660s in SLI. Smooth as butter, with Vsync off.Working with my Thrustmaster T150 wheel, with T3PA pedals and a pair of TH8A shifters... one for shifting and the other for handbrake. I was worried about this, since racing games with anything but my racing cockpit simply sucks.I'm connected and being challenged to races by other players. I am declining since I am just learning the game so far and have no upgrades.Love the game, I like the fact that the view turns into corners in cockpit view, something from the old Cross Racing Championship 2005 game that I wish all race games would have. Plenty of cars to choose from. Obviously, they don't handle like a sim but that's not what I bought this game for. Open world cruising like Need For Speed World was with some upgrading of you character elements. Buying new houses, garages, clothes, cosmetically changing your looks, etc. Kinda goofy but kinda cool at the same time.The scales is huge, I had to drive 2 miles to see the cosmetic doctor and it felt like it.Steam Summer sale for the win! content:
er 5, 2014
												Test Drive Unlimited 2 all about cars (and 3 sport bikes) and roaming around entire island. It's fun , but not realy. It lets you live the life of a pro racer on the Mediterranean island of Ibiza. It combines traditional racing with an open-world, always-online (except when it's not) multiplayer setup that makes it easy to interact with others. You can even buy property on the island, decorate said property, and show off your exotic car collection to your friends. game so much todo but get repetitif sing all you do is driving around and take challenges, from andrenaline, topspeed, time limit, convoi, etc. The portion of the chalange reuse over and over with the same dialogue cutscene.AI doesn't give player any good, they drive slow and easy to beat. Well, You can try to play online and face a real player,but since the connection is poor, and lately server is unknown.(read:today) all you can do is drive around in empty vast island.When it comes to the actual driving, there are just as many conflicting issues. I respect the game's attempt to bridge the gap between arcade-style racing and realistic simulation controls. But ultimately the cars in Test Drive lack the visceral quality that real vehicles possess.  I felt like I was controlling a toy.My self Recommend this to enyone who love cars and driving around island and find collectible, but not recommend to player who seek challlange in race.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
2016
 Note : This may not be worth the purchase, maybe best off with a torrent, since it's near impossible to run without the Universal Launcher. I feel like my hours in this may be invalid now (again, having to use the Universal Launcher), but that doesn't stop me from saying it's not good. It just really didn't have long lasting servers. If you're looking for online play, then I'd seek another review and some guides.But this game is really good even offline. It's pretty much a poor man's Forza Horizon (although this was 2011 and FH1 was 2012). It's got two open worlds, a  decent	 amount of cars, story that really isn't much worth it, decent music, and even something like the skills system.Getting the bad out of the way, the voice acting and story really isn't great. But why would you need it in a racing game? People also complain about the controls, but my advice is use a controller. Keyboard doesn't do the best justice with turning and it can really make things way too slidy sometimes. You'll slide much less with a controller.The good, just the gameplay and whatever else. Music is, again, just decent. But the gameplay is the main focus here. It's something you sorta have to get used to and once you do it's pretty smooth. Smooth(ish, lack of updates now might show its age) gameplay, graphics, etc. It's just a good racing game. Almost all I can say. Small bit of customization. Even character and house customization. Even DLC if you want to throw money at a dead game.TL;DR : Either wait until this is on sale or torrent it and use the Universal Launcher. It's pretty good. Not bad, but not the best. Definitely enjoyable even if it fits that "alright" section.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
er 3, 2016
												The Test Drive franchise has ever been an "also-ran" compared to more famous franchises like the Need For Speed or the Gran Turismo games, and Unlimited 2 did nothing to improve the series. Although it had a huge open world - still larger than those found in many competing series today - even at the time of its release in 2011, the game looked substantially worse than any other racer and it certainly hasn't improved with time. Worse, it was saddled with an uninteresting TV race show - with the requisite unlikable and shallow characters - as a framing device for level progression. But it's real sin was that it just wasn't fun to drive.The driving mechanics are terrible, with every vehicle over-steering to such a degree that it is almost impossible to drive. Even at low speeds, the cars slip and slide all over the road as if the asphalt were coated with ice; racing is far more chore than adrenalin-fueled excitement. To be fair, driving around the vast open worlds is quite enjoyable - there's a lot to see and find - but this pleasure is hampered by the substandard graphics and the too-slow progression. There's just something wrong if a racer is more fun to drive at 50mph than at 150mph. The game also does its best to force you online - whether you want or not -  with numerous features locked away until you create an online account, but given how empty the online community is these days I wish the developers had put more effort into the single-player.

content:
9
												A complete downgrade from the original.Cons:- Blocky textures- NPCs that appear closer to blow up dolls than people.- Cars handle like they're solid blocks of concrete with wheels and an engine attached.- Terrible storyline - why include this in a game that offers a "simulator" setting?- UI feels like a mid-2000s educational program. Was that a disfigured distant cousin of comic sans?- Being walked through the introductory stage was akin to death by one thousand papercuts - I'd rather end it all early.Pros:- Exit button is easy to find and works smoothly.All in all, horrendously bad in all aspects. I'll be refunding this if I'm within the time limit. There's nothing more to say.

												The game is buggy as hell. Several problems launching it or connecting to the servers. Random crashes, too. For me it has completely stopped working as of a few days ago.No online solution I've looked into works for me at all. Atari support is non-existant. And Steam won't do a thing for you if the game crashes and stops working after their refund period (2 weeks of purchase, 2 hours of playtime) has passed.Stay away from this trap.
